description_of_incident: CONTRACTOR RUPTURED 8' DISTRIBUTION PIPELINE RELEASING NATURAL GAS. EVACUATIONS, ROAD CLOSURES HAVE BEEN EFFECTED BY YUMA FD, PD. RELEASE HAS NOT BEEN SECURED.

description_of_incident: THE CALLER REPORTS THAT THE FACILITY RECIEVED 4 TOTES OF MATERIAL THAT WERE BEING OFFLOADED INTO A STORAGE TANK, MATERIALS REACTED AND RELEASED GAS REDDISH/YELLOW/BROWN (NITROGEN DIOXIDE?) TO THE ATMOSPHERE.
desc_remedial_action: PERSONNEL DONNED APPROPRIATE PROTECTIVE GEAR .  INVESTIGATION ONGOING.
additional_info: 10 POUND AMOUNT RELEASED IS AN INITIAL ESTIMATE, CALCULATIONS ARE ONGOING.  THE FACILITY DID TEST THE MATERIAL PRIOR TO OFF-LOAD, AT THE TIME IT DID NOT APPEAR THAT MATERIALS WOULD REACT.  THE CALLER REQUESTS ADVICE ON REPORTING REQUIREMENTS FOR THIS INCIDENT AND LOCATION.  THE MATERIAL THAT WAS MIXED DID NOT MEET THE CRITERIA FOR HAZARDOUS WASTE.

description_of_incident: TRACTOR TRAILER TANK TRUCK WAS STRUCK BY A PASSENGER CAR.  TRUCK ROLLED AND SPILLED FUEL FROM THE CARGO TANK.
desc_remedial_action: FIRE DEPT FLUSHED THE STORM DRAINS WITH WATER.  OFFLOADED THE REMAINING 4000 GALLONS OF PRODUCT FROM THE TRAILER.
additional_info: CALLER STATES HE IS UNSURE HOW LONG THE ROAD WAS CLOSED,  AT LEAST 12 HOURS.  DRIVER OF THE TRUCK AND PASSENGER OF THE AUTOMOBILE WERE SENT TO THE HOSPITAL.

description_of_incident: A COMPANY DRIVER WAS HEADING WESTBOUND ON I-40 IN OZARK, AR WHEN HE/SHE HIT THE GUARD RAIL IN A CONSTRUCTION ZONE, CAUSING THE RELEASE OF 100 GAL DIESEL FROM THE TRACTOR SADDLE TANKS.  INCIDENT CAUSED CLOSURE OF WESTBOUND I-40.
desc_remedial_action: COMMERCIAL HAZMAT CLEANUP COMPANY (ERS) O/S.  THE LOCAL FIRE DEPT. ALSO O/S.
additional_info: THE CALLER HAD LIMITED INFORMATION FROM THE TRUCK DISPATCHER.  THE TRUCK DRIVER PHONED THE DISPATCHER FOLLOWING THE INCIDENT BUT DID NOT GIVE ALL THE INFORMATION REQUESTED IN THIS REPORT.  THE CALLER STATED HE BELIEVED THE TRACTOR TRAILER WAS THE ONLY VEHICLE INVOLVED IN THE INCIDENT.  INJURIES UNKNOWN.  THE CALLER DID NOT KNOW WHAT THE TRAILER WAS CARRYING, OR THE FUEL CAPACITY OF THE TRACTOR.  THE CALLER HAD NOT RECEIVED ANY MEDIA CALLS.  THERE IS FULL CLOSURE OF WESTBOUND I-40 AT THE INCIDENT SCENE.  ONLY ONE LANE WAS OPEN DUE TO CONSTRUCTION.  THE CALLER STATED HE WAS TOLD THE SPILLED FUEL WAS FLOWING TOWARDS A WATER SOURCE BUT THAT THE HAZMAT COMPANY AND FIRE DEPT. DAMMED IT BEFORE IT COULD REACH THE WATER.

description_of_incident: THE MATERIAL RELEASED FROM A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK CARGO DUE TO DRIVER HITTING ANOTHER TRACTOR TRAILER WHICH MADE THE MATERIAL COME THROUGH THE FRONT OF THE TRAILER.

description_of_incident: ON 11/15/04 A DRUM OF 35% HYDROGEN PEROXIDE LIQUID (OWNED BY GEOLOGIC SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY, PO BOX 50478, DENTON, TX 76206) WAS BEING STORED IN ATC ASSOCIATES' REMEDIATION WARE HOUSE AT 1615 W UNIVERSITY DRIVE, SUITE 132, TEMPE, ARIZONA 85281.  THE DRUM RUPTURED DUE TO PRESSURE AND RELEASED 20 TO 30 GALLONS OF 35% HYDROGEN PEROXIDE LIQUID AT APPROXIMATELY 21:15 ON 11/15/04.  THE HYDROGEN PEROXIDE LIQUID FLOWED OUT THE REAR OF THE WARE HOUSE BENEATH THE GARAGE DOOR, AND PUDDLED IN THE ASPHALT PARKING LOT CONCRETE GUTTER DRAINS.  THE RUPTURE SET OFF THE BURGLAR ALARM, POLICE RESPONDED, AND THEN THE POLICE AND AN ATC EMPLOYEE DISCOVERED THE RUPTURED DRUM.  THE TEMPE FIRE DEPARTMENT AND HAZMAT TEAM RESPONDED.  NO CLEAN-UP ACTION WAS IMPLEMENTED BY THE TEMPE FIRE DEPARTMENT AND HAZMAT TEAM.  THE TEMPE FIRE DEPARTMENT REQUESTED THE RELEASE BE CLEANED-UP BY AN EMERGENCY RESPONSE CONTRACTOR.  AN EMERGENCY RESPONSE CONTRACTOR SOAKED UP THE LIQUID, THEN SPRAYED THE IMPACTED AREA WITH SOAPY WATER THEN SOAKED UP THE LIQUID AGAIN. TEMPE FIRE DEPT INSPECTED THE IMPACTED AREA ON 11/16/04 AND DETERMINED THE RELEASE WAS CLEANED UP.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR CLEANED UP AREA AND FIRE DEPT INSPECTED
additional_info: RECEIVED VIA WEB

description_of_incident: AT APPROXIMATELY 1:00 P.M. IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE CITY DUMP IN NACO, SONORA MEXICO HAD CAUGHT FIRE.  AS BEFORE CAUSTIC SMOKE FROM THE DUMP FIRE COULD HAVE BLOWN ACROSS THE U.S. MEXICO BORDER INTO NACO AND BISBEE, ARIZONA.  DUE TO THE WIND DIRECTION THE SMOKE WAS DRIFTING SE TOWARD DOUGLAS, AZ.  AT THE REQUEST OF THE NACO, SONORA FIRE DEPARTMENT, THE NACO, ARIZONA VOLUNTEER FIRE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED ACROSS THE BORDER TO ASSIST IN EXTINGUISHING THE FIRE.
incident_location: CITY DUMP OF NACO, SONORA MEXICO
desc_remedial_action: FIRE WAS EXTINGUISHED BY THE NACO, SONORA MEXICO AND NACO, ARIZONA FIRE DEPTS.
additional_info: THIS DUMP IN NACO, SONORA MEXICO HAS NORMAL HOUSEHOLD TRASH, MEDICAL WASTE AND A LARGE AMOUNT OF PLASTICS IN THE DUMP.  APPROXIMATELY 1 ACRE OF THE DUMP WAS ON FIRE PUTTING OUT LARGE AMOUNTS OF CAUSTIC SMOKE.  DUE TO THE WIND DIRECTION DURING THIS FIRE, THE SMOKE DID NOT COME ACROSS THE U.S. MEXICO BORDER IN THE NACO, AZ AREA.  AZ DEPT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY HAS SET UP AN AIR MONITORING SYSTEM.

description_of_incident: THE CALLER REPORTED THAT FOUR LOCOMOTIVES AND SIX RAILCARS DERAILED DUE TO UNKNOWN REASONS.  ALL FOUR LOCOMOTIVES ARE IN THE UPRIGHT POSITION AND THE RAILCARS ARE LYING ON THEIR SIDES.  THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT IS REPORTING THAT HYDROCHLORIC ACID IS LEAKING FROM ONE OF THE RAILCARS THAT DERAILED.  THE MATERIAL THAT THE OTHER DERAILED RAILCARS WERE TRANSPORTING ARE SODIUM HYDROXIDE, HYPOCHLORIC SOLUTION, AND SODIUM HYDROXIDE.  OFFICIALS ARE RESPONDING TO THE SCENE TO INVESTIGATE THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT. ONE RAIL EMPLOYEE WAS INJURED (BACK PAIN) AND SENT TO THE HOSPITAL.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A PLANE CRASH WHICH OCCURRED AT THE HAVASU NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE. THERE WAS ONE OTHER PASSENGER ONBOARD WHO ALSO WAS ABLE TO SAFELY EJECT OUT OF THE AIRCRAFT IN TIME.  THE AIRCRAFT CAUGHT ON FIRE ONCE BOTH INDIVIDUALS GOT OUT.  CALLER DESCRIBED THE AIRCRAFT AS A "C-WIND 3000 AMPHIBIOUS AIRPLANE WITH A SINGLE ENGINE ON TOP OF THE COCKPIT".

desc_remedial_action: THE PLANE WAS BOOMED OFF, CLEAN UP IS UNDERWAY, MATERIAL IS CONTAINED
additional_info: THERE WAS NOT AN EMERGENCY FUEL DUMP INVOLVED.

description_of_incident: ////////WEB REPORT////////  ON JUNE 14,2006 @ 1921 HRS., A PARTY BOAT TIED TO THE OWNERS DOCK, CAUGHT FIRE. THE FIRE BURNT THE OWNER 60% OF HIS BODY, THE BOAT WAS DESTROYED. ACCORDING TO THE OWNER HE HAD JUST FILLED THE TWO TANKS ON THE BOAT APPROXIMATELY 90+ GALLONS.  WHILE ATTEMPTING TO DO THE FIRE INVESTIGATION, WE FOUND THE GAS TANKS HAD NOT BEEN DAMAGED, BEFORE WE COULD FURTHER INSPECT THE TANKS, THE BOAT SANK. WE SAW A SHEEN AND SMELLED A ODOR OF FUEL COMING FROM THE HULL. WE CONTACTED THE POLICE DEPT, WHO HAS JURISDICTION OVER THE WATER WAYS. THE CORPORAL STATED THAT IT WAS THE OWNER'S RESPONISIBLITY FOR CLEAN UP. I TOLD HIM THAT THE OWNER WAS CRITICALLY INJURY AND WAS FLOWN TO LAS VEGAS BURN CENTER. BEFORE LEAVING THE SITE, WE INFORMED THE NEIGHBORS ABOUT THE SPILL. I SUBMITTED A REPORT TO THE STATE OF ARIZONA. I WAS CONTACTED BY THE DAN ROE AND SUGGESTED THAT WE REPORT THIS TO YOU.  WHEN THE BOAT WAS REMOVED FROM THE WATER THE TANKS WERE EMPTY.
incident_location: PRIVATE DOCK IN AN CHANNEL OF THE COLORADO RIVER
desc_remedial_action: CALLED THE POLICE DEPT., WHO IS THE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY FOR THE RIVER.
additional_info: NO FOLLOW UP AT THIS TIME. BOAT HAS BEEN REMOVED BY INSURANCE COMPANY TO UNKNOWN LOCATION.

description_of_incident: //////WEB REPORT//////  TRACTOR TRAILER WAS INVOLVED IN A MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENT ON 09/08/06.  THE PA TURNPIKE AUTHORITY REPORTED NO WATERWAYS IMPACTED, ONLY SPILL INTO A SOIL MEDIAN.  ON 09/11/06, DURING CONVERSATIONS WITH THE RESPONSE CONTRACTOR, IT WAS NOTED THAT DUE TO HEAVY RAINS IN THE AREA THERE WAS A POTENTIAL FOR A STORM DRAIN LOCATED NEAR THE SPILL AREA TO BE IMPACTED.
incident_location: PENNSYLVANIA TURNPIKE (I-70 / I-76) MILE MARKER 165 WB NEAR BREEZEWOOD,PA MEDIAN
desc_remedial_action: THE TURNPIKE AUTHORITY DISPATCHED A CONTRACTOR TO SECURE, CONTAIN AND REMEDIATE THE SPILL SITE.  ACTUAL REMEDIATION PENDING FAVORABLE WEATHER & TRAFFIC CONDITIONS.
additional_info: THIS SPILL WAS NOT THREATENING ANY WATERWAY AT THE TIME OF OCCURRENCE.  HOWEVER, THE POTENTIAL NOW EXISTS FOR IT TO IMPACT SURFACE WATERS, ALTHOUGH NONE HAVE BEEN IMPACTED AT THIS TIME.  THE CONTRACTOR ON-SCENE WAS HIRED BY THE PA TURNPIKE AND REPORTS DIRECTLY TO THEM.  ERTS REQUESTED CONTEMPORARY INFORMATION, BUT THE CONTRACTOR IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO PROVIDE IT.

description_of_incident: ////   TAKEN FROM WEB REPORT  //////     MARICOPA SHERIFF'S SHOOTING RANGE WAS CONDUCTING A SPECIAL WEAPONS AND TACTICS EXERCISE FOR SWAT TRAINING THAT INVOLVES THE USE OF CS GAS (TEAR GAS). I WAS OUT SIDE MY HOME DOING SOME YARD WORK WHEN I WAS OVERCOME BY THE GAS. MY HUSBAND CAME OUT TO SEE WHAT WAS HAPPENING AND REALIZED THAT THERE WAS A CLOUD OF TEAR GAS OVERHEAD. HE BROUGHT ME INTO THE HOUSE AND CALLED 911. I HAD UNCONTROLABLE CAUGH, BURNING EYES, NOSE AND THROAT. THE FIRE DEPT. WAS UNABLE TO REACH OUR HOME BECAUSE THEY TOO WERE OVERCOME WITH THE TOXIC GAS. THEY WERE DELAYED APPROX 15MIN. IN GETTING TO ME. FIVE FIREMEN WENT DOWN WITH THE EFFECTS OF THE GAS. THEY HAD TO GO BACK, FIND OUT THE TYPE OF GAS THEY WERE DEALING WITH, AND DEPLOY RESPIRATORS. WHEN THEY FINIALY REACHED US THEY IMMEDIATELY TOOK ME INTO THE FIRE TRUCK BECAUSE THE AMBULANCE COULD NOT APPROCH THE HOUSE BECAUSE THEY HAD NO EQUIPMENT TO PROTECT THEMSELVES. I WAS TAKEN TO DEL WEBB HOSPITAL EMERGENCY WHERE I WAS TREATED AND LATER RELEASED. I WAS INSTRUCTED TO SEE MY DOCTOR THE FOLLOWING DAY, WHICH I DID. I WAS GIVEN ADDITIONAL MEDICATION AS I AM STILL HAVING THE ADVERSE AFFECTS OF CS GAS.      /// TAKEN FROM WEB REPORT  ///
incident_location: FROM THE SHERIFF'S DEPT SHOOTING RANGE
desc_remedial_action: UNKNOWN
additional_info: ////WEB REPORT/////  THERE ARE AN UNKNOWN NUMBER OF INJURIES AT THIS TIME.  THE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE ROAD CLOSURES ARE UNKNOWN AS WELL.         ////// TAKEN FROM WEB REPORT -I LIVE APPROX HALF MILE FROM THE MARICOPA COUNTY SHERIFF'S SHOOTING RANGE. AS I WAS WORKING IN FRONT OF MY HOME ON 16 NOVEMBER 2006 AT APPROX 18:30 I WAS OVERCOME BY A NOXIOUS BURNING GAS. MY SYMPTOMS BECAME SEVERE, I HAD EXTREME DIFFIULTY BREATHING, BURNING OF MY EYES, THROAT AND NOSE. I WAS COUGHING AND CHOKING.  //////

PD WAS NOTIFIED AND CURRENCY TAKEN INTO EVIDENCE. NO FURTHER ACTIONS BY LHCFD.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING ACTIVITY OF MULTIPLE VEHICLES COMING OUT INTO THE LA PAZ COUNTY DESERT, AT THE BAUSE RV PARK, CHANGING THEIR OIL, LEAVING THE OLD OIL  AND OIL FILTERS OUT IN THE DESERT.  THIS ACTIVITY HAS BEEN GOING ON FOR YEARS.  RECENTLY A CAMPER WITH ALASKA PLATES AND A WHITE BLAZER WITH OREGON PLATES WAS OBSERVED AT THE SITE LEAVING THE OLD OIL AND OIL FILTERS OUT IN THE DESERT.   CALLER IS ON AN RV PARK WHICH IS SERVICED BY WELL WATER.  CALLER IS CONCERNED ABOUT POSSIBLE CONTAMINATION TO THE LOCAL WELL WATER SUPPLY.
desc_remedial_action: NONE
additional_info: CALLER CAN TAKE INVESTIGATORS DIRECTLY TO THE SPOT WHERE THE VEHICALS USUALLY CHANGE THE OIL.

additional_info: GRANULAR ABSORBENTS WERE UTILIZED TO REMOVE THE FUEL THAT HAD IMPACTED THE ASPHALT.

description_of_incident: ON FEBRUARY 3, A SWIFT TRANSPORTATION TRACTOR TRAILER HAD A SADDLE TANK PUNCTURED WHILE IN TRANSIT. ORIGINAL REPORTS INDICATED 15 GALLONS ON ASPHALT. THE SPILL WAS LATER DISCOVERED TO BE CLOSER TO 80 GALLONS. THE DIESEL FUEL WAS WASHED INTO A STORM DRAIN AND EVENTUALLY ENDED UP IN AN OPEN DITCH. THE ORIGINAL REPORTS INDICATED THAT FUEL WAS CONTAINED IN THIS DITCH AND WOULD NOT TRAVEL BEYOND IT. ON SITE INSPECTION ON 03/19/08 CONFIRMED THE FUEL REMAINED IN THE DITCH AND DID NOT TRAVEL BEYOND IT.
incident_location: I-80 OFFRAMP TO MCCARRAN BLVD., SPARKS, NEVADA
desc_remedial_action: SPILL WAS CONTAINED IN DITCH. ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE CONTRACTOR UTILIZED ABSORBENTS TO SEQUESTER FREE PRODUCT. SITE WAS REVISITED ON 03/19 TO CONFIRM NO ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT REMAINED.
additional_info: THE SITE HAS BEEN CLEANED. REVIEW WITH A PID METER CONFIRMED THAT NO DIESEL REMAINED ON SITE.

description_of_incident: A TRACTOR TRAILER WAS INVOLVED IN A MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENT WITH ANOTHER TRACTOR TRAILER HAULING LIVE CATTLE.  THE TRACTOR TRAILERS COLLIDED AND RESULTED IN A RELEASE OF DIESEL FUEL ONTO THE GROUND NEAR A STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: ERTS DISPATCHED DSC ENVIRONMENTAL TO THE SITE TO PROVIDE INITIAL RESPONSE AS WELL AS REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES.  THE FUEL WAS CONTAINED WITHIN THE STORM DRAIN AND DID NOT IMPACT ANY WATER WAYS.  DSC PERSONNEL PLACED ABSORBENT BOOMS IN DRAIN
additional_info: IT WAS NOT REPORTED THAT ANY IMPACT HAD AFFECTED A STORM DRAIN UNTIL TODAY.  UPON NOTIFICATION I HAVE COMPLETED THE REQUIRED NRC REPORTING.

description_of_incident: APPROXIMATELY 150 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL WAS RELEASED ON I-5 NORTHBOUND EXIT 30 NEAR KALAMA, WASHINGTON.  FUEL WAS RELEASED ONTO ASPHALT AND ADJACENT SOILS.  AREAS OF SOIL 150X4 FT AND 20X20 FT HAVE BEEN IMPACTED.  AREA OF ASPHALT 1/2 MILE LONG WAS ALSO IMPACTED.  GRANULAR ABSORBENTS HAVE BEEN APPLIED TO AFFECTED ASPHALT, IMPACTED SOIL WILL BE COVERED AND EXCAVATED AT A LATER DATE.  CONTRACTOR WENT BACK TO SCALES AND REMOVED RELEASED DIESEL FUEL AT THAT LOCATION ALSO.  ESTIMATED THAT DRIVER MAY HAVE BEEN LEAKING FUEL FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF TIME.  STREET SWEEPER USED TO REMOVE IMPACTED ABSORBENTS FROM THE ASPHALT AREA.  CATCH BASINS HAVE BEEN PUMPED AND THE ROADWAY HAS BEEN RE-SWEPT DUE TO HEAVY RAINFALL CAUSING A SHEEN ON THE ASPHALT SURFACE AND NEARBY CATCH BASINS.
desc_remedial_action: NRC ENVIRONMENTAL CONTRACTOR ONSITE TO CONDUCT ANY FURTHER REMEDIATION.
additional_info: NO FURTHER INFORMATION GIVEN.

THE PUMP WAS NOT TAKEN OUT OF SERVICE AFTER THE INCIDENT.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A DIESEL SPILL FROM A TRACTOR TRAILER DUE TO AN TRANSPORT ACCIDENT. ONE INJURIES REPORTED. THIS IS A SINGLE VEHICLE ACCIDENT.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR HAS BEEN HIRED TO SET THE TRUCK UPRIGHT. CLEAN UP IS COMPLETE.
additional_info: CALLER STATES THERE IS A STORM DRAIN BELOW THE INTERSTATE BUT IT IS UNKNOWN IF THE MATERIAL REACHED THE WATER. CALLER HAD NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: AT APPROX 2:15 AM, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS A RELEASE OF SODIUM HYPOCHLORITE AT THE RHENIUM PLANT. A PIPE LOCATED ON THE SIDE OF THE TANK BECAME LOOSE AND ONE EXTREME FELL OUTSIDE OF THE SECONDARY COTAINMENT, APPROX 1100 GAL OF SODIUMM HYPOCHLORITE WERE SPILLED OUTSIDE OF THE SECONDARY CONTAINMENT. APPROX 200 GAL WERE RECOVERED AND PLACED IN DRUMS.
incident_location: SOIDUM HYPROCHLORITE STORAGE TANK AT THE RHENIUM PLANT
desc_remedial_action: UNKNOWN
additional_info: NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A DISCHARGE OF PREMIUM GASOLINE FROM OVERFLOW OF AN UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK. THE CAUSE OF THE OVERFLOW WAS FROM A MIS-UNDERSTANDING OF THE SIZE OF THE TANK. THE RELEASE WENT INTO A STORM DRAIN WHICH LEADS TO A PRIVATELY OWNED DRY RETENTION POND.
desc_remedial_action: VAC TRUCK WILL BE USED. A DIFFERENT TEAM WILL BE CONDUCTING EXCAVATION IN THE MORNING.
additional_info: CALLER HAS NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A SPILL OF COPPER CONCENTRATE FROM AN ALUMINUM DUMP TRAILER TO THE ROADWAY DUE TO THE REAR OF THE TRAILER CATCHING FIRE, WHICH MELTED THE TRAILER. CAUSE OF FIRE IS UNKNOWN.
desc_remedial_action: RESPONSE TEAM IS ON SCENE. DOTHAZMAT REPRESENTATIVE IS ON SCENE.
additional_info: CALLER DID NOT KNOW HOW LONG THE ROAD WAS CLOSED FOR BUT ALL BUT ONE LANE ARE CURRENTLY OPEN.

description_of_incident: A DRUM OF STYRENE ON A TRAILER TIPPED OVER AND WAS PUNCTURED IN THE PROCESS. AS A RESULT, THE PRODUCT LEAKED OUT OF THE DRUM. THE VEHICLE WAS IN MOTION WHEN THE DRUM TIPPED OVER. A PALLET BROKE UNDER THE DRUM, PUTTING IT OFF BALANCE.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTORS ARE ON SCENE FOR CLEANUP; FD IS ON SCENE; DRUM WILL BE OVERPACKED; REMAINING CARGO WILL BE RE-PACKED TO PREVENT A REPEAT INCIDENT
additional_info: THE CALLER STATED THAT MOST OF THE DRUM'S CONTENTS WERE CONTAINED WITHIN THE TRAILER, AND APPROXIMATELY 2 GALLONS IMPACTED THE PAVEMENT.
state_agency_notified: FD, PD, EMS, COUNTY HAZMAT, AZ DOT

description_of_incident: TRACTOR TRAILER PUNCTURED A SADDLE TANK WHILE MANEUVERING THROUGH THE PARKING LOT.  THE PUNCTURED SADDLE TANK SUBSEQUENTLY RELEASED ~20 GALLONS OF FUEL ONTO THE ASPHALT WITH SOME OF THE MATERIAL ENTERING A NEARBY STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: TAS ENVIRONMENTAL HAS BEEN DISPATCHED TO THE SITE FOR INITIAL RESPONSE AND REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES.
additional_info: NONE

description_of_incident: CALLER REPORTED THAT THEY SMELLED AMMONIA AND FOUND A LEAK IN A COOLING TOWER.
desc_remedial_action: TANK IS UNDER REPAIR.
additional_info: CALLER HAD NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK WAS INVOLVED IN A MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENT WHICH RESULTED IN A PUNCTURED SADDLE TANK AND SUBSEQUENT RELEASE OF DIESEL FUEL INTO A WATER-FILLED DITCH.  THE HEAVY RAIN FALL IN THE AREA BEGAN FLUSHING THE RELEASED FUEL INTO AN UNDERGROUND DRAIN PIPE.  THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT PLACED BOOMS AROUND THE AREA TO HELP PREVENT ADDITIONAL MIGRATION OF FUEL INTO THE DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: A CONTRACTOR WAS DISPATCHED TO THE SITE FOR INITIAL RESPONSE AND REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES.  THE MISSOURI DEPT OF NATURAL RESOURCES IS ALSO HEADED TO THE SITE TO DETERMINE LOCATION OF OUTFALL.
additional_info: NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION WAS PROVIDED.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A RELEASE OF MATERIAL FROM AN AC UNIT DUE TO CHANGING OUT A REFRIGERATION UNIT.
desc_remedial_action: CLEANUP COMPLETED
additional_info: CALLER WILL NOTIFY ADEQ.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A FREIGHT TRAIN STRUCK A TRESPASSER RESULTING IN A FATALITY.
desc_remedial_action: TUSCON FIRE AND POLICE ARE ON SCENE AS WELL AS UP SPECIAL AGENT. INVESTIGATION IS TAKING PLACE.
additional_info: CALLER DID KNOW THE TRAIN OR TRACK SPEED.

description_of_incident: WHILE TRAVELLING ON A ROADWAY PER GPS SHORTCUT THE ROAD BECAME A DIRT ROAD.  WHEN UNABLE TO RETURN BACK, THE TRACTOR-TRAILER LEFT THE ROADWAY AND FELL ON THE PASSENGER SIDE.  THIS CRIMPED THE SADDLE TANK AND CAUSED THE RELEASE OF APPROXIMATELY 30 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL.
desc_remedial_action: AREA HAS BEEN SECURED.  REMEDIATION IS PENDING.
additional_info: SPILL REPORTED PER ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY REQUIREMENT._x000D_

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A POTENTIAL RELEASE OF PROPANE DUE TO A HOUSE EXPLOSION.  CALLER STATES THAT IT DOES NOT APPEAR THAT THEIR WAS A FIRE.  THE HOUSE WAS STRUCTURALLY DAMAGED.  THERE WERE NO REPORTED INJURIES IN THIS INCIDENT.  THE HOUSE WAS CONNECTED TO AN UNDERGROUND PROPANE LINE.
desc_remedial_action: THE FIRE DEPARTMENT REMOVED THE ELECTRIC METERS. INVESTIGATING EXPLOSION. THE GAS COMPANY CHECKED TO MAKE SURE THERE WERE NO LEAKS.
additional_info: CALLER HAS NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: DIESEL FUEL DISCHARGED FROM A SADDLE TANK OF A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK THAT WAS  INVOLVED IN A MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENT.  SOIL WAS IMPACTED IN THE MEDIAN AND POSSIBLY A STORM DRAIN WAS ALSO IMPACTED IN THE MEDIAN.  ADPS AND ADOT ON SITE.  KARY ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES RESPONDED TO SITE TO BEGIN REMEDIATION.
desc_remedial_action: KARY ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES RESPONDED TO THE SITE TO SECURE THE RELEASE.  THEY WERE INSTRUCTED BY ADOT TO SECURE THE SITE AND APPLY A BIOREMEDIATION ACCELERANT TO THE IMPACTED AREAS OF SOIL AND POSSIBLE STORM DRAIN.
additional_info: NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A RELEASE OF DIESEL FROM A SADDLE FUEL TANK DUE TO DEBRIS RUPTURING THE TANK OF THE TRACTOR TRAILER CAUSING THE MATERIAL TO GO ONTO THE SHOULDER OF THE ROAD AND INTO A STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: THE DIESEL FUEL HAS BEEN SECURED. EXCAVATION WILL BE CONDUCTED. THE STORM DRAIN WILL BE FLUSHED.
additional_info: CALLER HAS NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT THEIR LOCAL WASTE MANAGEMENT DUMP TRUCKS HAVE BEEN LEAKING HYDRAULIC OIL ONTO THE GROUND EVERYTIME THAT THEY COME THROUGH ON TUESDAYS AND FRIDAYS. THE CAUSE OF THE LEAK IS UNKNOWN AT THIS TIME. CALLER STATES THAT HE HAS CALLED WASTE MANAGEMENT TO TELL THEM OF THE PROBLEM BUT THE PROBLEM STILL PERSISTS. AT ABOUT ONE O CLOCK THE MATERIAL WAS SEEN DRIPPING FROM THE TRUCKS TODAY.
desc_remedial_action: NONE
additional_info: CALLER HAS NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A RELEASE OF A "FLAMMABLE LIQUID NOS HAZARD CLASS 3" FROM A 55 GALLON DRUM THAT WAS BEING TRANSPORTED BY A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK DUE TO UNKNOWN CAUSES AT THIS TIME.  CALLER SUSPECTS THERE WAS A FAILURE OF THE CONTAINER SOMEWHERE TOWARDS THE BOTTOM OF THE DRUM.  CALLER ALSO DESCRIBED THE MATERIAL INVOLVED IN THE RELEASE AS "UN1993, CONTAINING TOLUENE & XYLENE, PACKING GROUP 2".  TIME OF INCIDENT: 1815 CST.

additional_info: CALLER STATES THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF MATERIAL INVOLVED IN THE RELEASE IS ANYWHERE BETWEEN 1 - 3 GALLONS.

description_of_incident: DRIVER WAS TRAVELING SOUTH THRU THE TOWN OF ELFRIDA ARIZONA WHEN THE MOTORIST AHEAD PULLED TO THE SHOULDER.  THE DRIVER SLOWED AS HE APPROACHED THE VEHICLE.  THE MOTORIST THEN MADE A U-TURN AND STRUCK OUR UNIT IN THE PASSENGER SIDE WHICH CAUSED THE PLUMBING TO COME OFF OF THE TRAILER RESULTING IN A SPILL OF PRODUCT ON THE ROAD.  THE AMOUNT INVOLVED WAS 15 GALLONS WHICH WAS IMMEDIATELY CONTAINED BY THE DRIVER WITH A SPILL KIT.  POLICE AND FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS DISPATCHED TO THE SCENE AND THERE WERE NO INJURIES.  THE MOTORIST DID ADMIT GUILT AND WILL BE CITED FOR AN ILLEGAL LANE U-TURN AND FAILURE TO SEE ONCOMING TRAFFIC.  SAFETY IS EN-ROUTE TO ASSIST IN OFF-LOADING THE TRUCK, AND THE MOTORIST VEHICLE WAS TOWED FROM THE SCENE.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR WILL BE CONTACTED FOR REMEDIAL ACTION IF DETERMINED NECESSARY.
additional_info: OTHER DRIVER FAILED TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY.
state_agency_notified: TRAVIS QUALLS ARIZONA DOT HAZMAT TEAM

MOTORIST THEN PROCEEDED TO MAKE A U TURN STRIKING OUR UNIT IN THE PASSENGER SIDE. MOTORIST HIT OUR VEHICLE ON THE PASSENGER SIDE STRIKING THE PLUMBING OFF THE TRAILER RESULTING IN A SPILL OF PRODUCT IN THE LINES. APPROX 15 GALS WAS SPILLED BUT IMMEDIATELY CONTAINED BY DRIVER WITH SPILL KIT. POLICE AND FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS DISPATCHED TO SCENE NO INJURIES. MOTORIST DID ADMIT GUILT AND WILL BE CITED FOR ILLEGAL LANE U-TURN AND FAILURE TO SEE ON-COMING TRAFFIC. SAFETY IS EN-ROUTE TO ASSIST IN OFF-LOADING OUR TRUCK, MOTORIST VEHICLE WILL BE TOWED FROM SCENE.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR WILL BE CONTACTED FOR REMEDIAL ACTION IF DETERMINED NECASSARY.
additional_info: OTHER DRIVER FAILED TO YIELD RIGHT OF WAY.

CALLER WAS ONLY ABLE TO DESCRIBE THE ODOR AS A "WEIRD SMELL LIKE SOMETHING SWEET BUT IT DOES NOT SMELL BAD".

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A NATURAL GAS RELEASE FROM A 1/2 INCH NIPPLE ON A VALVE BODY BLEED THAT IS PART OF A 36 INCH PIPELINE, DUE TO SUSPECTED MATERIAL FAILURE. THE NEAREST CITY AND COORDINATES ARE UNKNOWN AT THIS TIME.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A DISCHARGE OF DIESEL AND GASOLINE ONTO THE GROUND AT THE COMPANY FROM STORAGE TANKS DUE TO OPERATOR ERROR. description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT THE SUSPECTED RESPONSIBLE PARTY HAS BEEN DUMPING AUTOMOTIVE RELATED MATERIALS INTO THE SOIL NEAR THEIR PROPERTY WHICH IS LESS THAN ONE BLOCK FROM THE COLORADO RIVER. THE CALLER HAS OBSERVED THIS FOR OVER FOUR YEARS AND HAS STATED THAT THIS IS A COMMON PRACTICE.

additional_info: CALLER STATED THAT THE SUSPECTED RESPONSIBLE PARTY ALSO MANIPULATE THEIR CATALYTIC CONVERTERS TO AVOID REPLACING THEM.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT THERE WAS A TRANSPORTATION ACCIDENT INVOLVING A PASSENGER VEHICLE THAT COLLIDED INTO THE SIDE OF A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK. MATERIAL WAS RELEASED ONTO THE LAND AND SOME OF THE MATERIAL MIXED WITH THE RUNOFF WATER FROM FIRE FIGHTERS EXTINGUISHING THE FIRE THAT CAUSED THE OIL/WATER MIXTURE TO ENTER INTO THE STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: CALLER STATED THE FIRE WAS PUT OUT AND A CONTRACTOR HAS BEEN NOTIFIED TO CLEAN UP THE MATERIAL THAT WENT INTO THE STORM DRAIN.
additional_info: CALLER STATED THAT THE VEHICLES WERE A TOTAL LOSS, INCLUDING TRAILER ON THE TRUCK, AND A 30FT BY 20 FEET SECTION OF THE ASPHALT WAS DAMAGED. CALLER ALSO STATED THAT THE MATERIAL THAT WAS RELEASED INTO THE STORM DRAIN WHEN THE FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS EXTINGUISHING THE FIRE AND A MIXTURE OF WATER AND DIESEL MADE IT INTO THE STORM DRAIN.
state_agency_notified: GLENDALE FIRE AND POLICE, AZ DEQ

description_of_incident: THE CITY OPERATES A "BURN PILE" WHICH IS SUPPOSED TO BE ONLY FOR PLANT-BASED WASTE (BRANCHES, GRASS CLIPPINGS, ETC). THE CITY DOES NOT OVERSEE THIS PILE CLOSELY, AND AS A RESULT, THE CITIZENS DUMP INAPPROPRIATE MATERIALS ONTO THE PILE, INCLUDING FUEL RECEPTACLE.
desc_remedial_action: NONE AT TIME OF CALL
additional_info: CALLER HAD NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: A TANK DEVELOPED A CRACK, RESULTING IN A SPILL OF MATERIAL ONTO SOIL NEAR THE TANK.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER STRUCK SOME ROAD DEBRIS WHICH PUNCTURED ONE OF THE SADDLE TANKS RESULTING IN A RELEASE OF 30 TO 70 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL ONTO THE ROADWAY AND THE ADJACENT SOIL.
desc_remedial_action: UNKNOWN.
additional_info: CALLER HAD LIMITED INFORMATION AND WAS MAKING THE REPORT USING THIRD PARTY INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: TRACTOR TRAILER PUNCTURED SADDLE TANK AS A RESULT OF STRIKING ROAD DEBRIS.  THE DIESEL FUEL RAN ONTO THE ASPHALT ROAD SURFACE AS WELL AS SOILS ADJACENT TO THE ROADWAY.  THE INCIDENT OCCURRED LAST NIGHT AND IT WAS NOT NOTICED THAT ANY WATER WAYS WERE IMPACTED.  THIS MORNING THE OHIO EPA RECEIVED REPORTS THAT DIESEL FUEL HAD BEEN SEEN IN A SMALL STREAM THAT COLLECTS RUN OFF FROM THE I-80 TURNPIKE.
desc_remedial_action: ERTS DISPATCHED AN ENVIRONMENTAL CONTRACTOR BACK TO THE SITE FOR CLEANUP ACTIONS.
additional_info: ERTS AND THE OHIO EPA MET ON SITE TO REVIEW CORRECTIVE ACTIONS.  ABSORBENT BOOMS WILL BE UTILIZED TO CLEAN THE SHEEN FROM THE AFFECTED WATERWAY.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A RELEASE OF NATURAL GAS FROM A METER STATION THAT WAS ACCIDENTALLY STRUCK BY A THIRD PARTY PICK-UP TRUCK.  CALLER STATES THE DRIVER OF THE TRUCK LOST CONSCIENCE AND SWERVED OFF THE ROAD AND HIT THE METER STATION WHICH BROKE THE TAP OF A 2 INCH PIPELINE.  CALLER ALSO STATES THE RELEASE IS STILL ONGOING.
incident_location: NEAR KANSAS SETTLEMENT, ON SOUTH KANSAS SETTLEMENT ROAD
desc_remedial_action: CALLER STATES THEY DISPATCHED THEIR FIRST RESPONDERS TO THE SITE AND THEY ARE IN PROCESS OF ISOLATING THE SYSTEM AND MAINTAINING SERVICES TO CUSTOMERS.
additional_info: CALLER WILL NOTIFY THE AZ. CORPORATION COMMISSION.  THE ROAD CLOSURE IS POSSIBLY STILL ONGOING.  CALLER STATES THE DRIVER OF THE TRUCK SUFFERED A MEDICAL CONDITION THAT CAUSED THE ACCIDENT AND HE WAS SENT TO THE HOSPITAL.

description_of_incident: A TRACTOR TRAILER WAS INVOLVED IN A MULTIPLE VEHICLE ACCIDENT THAT CAUSED THE DISCHARGE OF DIESEL FUEL.  THE FUEL IMPACTED THE ASPHALT ROADWAY, SOIL DITCHLINE, AND A NEARBY CREEK.
desc_remedial_action: AN ENVIRONMENTAL CONTRACTOR, SWS, IS ON SITE USING ABSORBENT BOOMS, PADS AND GRANULAR ABSORBENTS TO COLLECT THE AVAILABLE FUEL AND TO PREVENT THE MIGRATION OF FUEL INTO THE WATERWAY. A VAC TRUCK IS EN ROUTE TO REMOVE FUEL FROM THE WATER.
additional_info: AFTER THE SITE IS CONTAINED TONIGHT, THE CONTRACTOR WILL RETURN TOMORROW TO EXCAVATE THE CONTAMINATED SOIL.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THERE WAS A RELEASE OF MATERIALS WHEN PIPELINE BROKE AND MATERIALS WERE RELEASED ONTO THE LAND.

description_of_incident: F-16 CRASH LANDED AT WICKENBURG, AZ AIRPORT.  POTENTIAL RELEASE OF HYDRAZINE AT SCENE.  SMELL OF HYDRAZINE AT SCENE.  SMELL COULD HAVE BEEN FROM EXHAUST OF EMERGENCY POWER UNIT, WHICH BURNS THE HYDRAZINE. EXTERNAL CENTERLINE WING TANK JETTISONED APPROXIMATELY 5 MILES SOUTH OF AIRPORT.  FUEL IS DRAWN FROM EXTERNAL TANKS FIRST, MISSION WAS APPROXIMATELY HALF COMPLETE, THEREFORE TANK WAS PROBABLY EMPTY BUT THERE IS A POTENTIAL FOR RESIDUAL FUEL.  NO LIVE MUNITIONS ON BOARD.  SPECIALIZED HYDRAZINE TEAM MAY BE ABLE TO DETERMINE IF RELEASE TO ATMOSPHERE OCCURRED.  WILL NOT HAVE REPORT FROM TEAM FOR APPROXIMATELY 24 HOURS.
desc_remedial_action: NONE AT THIS TIME.
additional_info: AT THIS TIME THIS IS A REPORT OF A POTENTIAL HYDRAZINE AND JP-8 FUEL RELEASE.  THIS REPORT WILL BE UPDATED IF IT IS CONFIRMED THERE WAS AN ACTUAL RELEASE.

CALLER STATES THE AREA IS STILL CONTAMINATED AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT.  THERE WAS APPROX. FIVE DUMP TRUCK LOADS AND POSSIBLY BATTERIES DUMPED INTO THIS 8 FOOT DEEP DITCH.  CALLER WAS ONLY ABLE TO GIVE VERY LIMITED LOCATION INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS MAKING A REPORT INVOLVING A HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT WHO BROUGHT AN AMOUNT OF MERCURY (POSSIBLY A TABLESPOON) ONTO A SCHOOL BUS AND WHILE SHOWING IT TO OTHER STUDENTS THE MERCURY SPILLED ONTO THE FLOOR OF THE BUS.  CALLER STATES ONCE THE BUS ARRIVED TO THE HIGH SCHOOL, THE STUDENT ALSO BROUGHT IT INTO THE CAFETERIA WHERE OTHER STUDENTS WERE LOOKING AT IT AND TOUCHING IT.  THE INCIDENT WAS LATER REPORTED TO THE OFFICE AT THE SCHOOL AND IT WAS THEN REPORTED TO THE CALLER'S AGENCY.  CALLER ALSO STATES BY THE TIME THEY WERE NOTIFIED OF THE INCIDENT, THE SAME BUS HAD ALREADY TRANSFERRED ABOUT 60 CHILDREN (ELEMENTARY STUDENTS).
desc_remedial_action: CALLER STATES THE BUS IS CURRENTLY IN THEIR PARKING LOT AND IT HAS BEEN TAPED OFF AND ISOLATED.  THE BUS WILL BE TESTED AND POSSIBLY CLEANED UP BY A CONTRACTOR.  THE FIRE DEPT. IS PERFORMING AN INVESTIGATION.
additional_info: CALLER STATES THE FIRE DEPT. DETERMINED THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF MATERIAL INVOLVED IN THE RELEASE ON THE BUS WAS "HALF OF TEASPOON TO A TEASPOON".  CALLER ALSO STATES STUDENTS WHO CAME IN CONTACT WERE CHECKED OUT BY PARAMEDICS AND SENT HOME.  ALL PARENTS HAVE BEEN NOTIFIED WHO'S CHILDREN POSSIBLY CAME IN CONTACT WITH THE MATERIAL.  ALL THE CLOTHES THE CHILDREN WERE WEARING WERE BAGGED UP.

description_of_incident: RESPONSIBLE PARTY WAS PULLING A TRAILER THAT HAD LIQUID ASPHALT EMULSION, WHICH IS WATER BASED, GOING TO LOCATIONS TO SEAL DRIVEWAYS.  ITEMS IN THE BACK OF THE TRUCK CAUGHT FIRE. THEY DID NOT HAVE A FIRE EXTINGUISHER AVAILABLE TO EXTINGUISH THE FIRE, SO THEY USED THE ASPHALT EMULSION.  AFTER AWHILE SOMEONE CALLED 9-1-1 FOR ASSISTANCE.  RURAL METRO FIRE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED AND EXTINGUISHED THE FIRE.  UPON ARRIVAL, THE OFFICER IN CHARGE NOTICED THE ASPHALT ON THE ROADWAY AND IN THE ROADWAY DRAINAGE DITCH.  THE OFFICER REQUESTED ASSISTANCE FROM PIMA COUNTY PUBLIC WORKS AND THE OFFICE OF EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT.  THE FIRE DEPT. ESTABLISHED SMALL DAMS TO STOP THE FLOW OF ASPHALT AND WATER FROM THE FIRE EXTINGUISHMENT, TO PREVENT THE LIQUIDS FROM ENTERING THE FINGER WASH.  PC PUBLIC WORKS BROUGHT SAND, APPROXIMATELY 7 YARDS, TO COVER THE ASPHALT IN THE STOPPED AREAS.  UPON AGREEMENT WITH ALL PARTIES INVOLVED, THE ASPHALT OF THE ROADWAY WAS SPREAD OUT ON THE ROADWAY, TO DRY.  PIMA COUNTY PUBLIC WORKS SUPERVISOR AND RESPONSIBLE PARTY AGREED UPON THE CONDITIONS OF THE CLEAN-UP OF THE ASPHALT AND SAND AND ANY DAMAGE TO THE DRAINAGE DITCH.
incident_location: INTERSECTION OF PANTATOC ROAD AND SKYLINE DRIVE IN PIMA COUNTY
desc_remedial_action: RURAL METRO FD ESTABLISHED DAMS WITH SOIL UNTIL PIMA COUNTY PUBLIC WORKS BROUGHT IN SAND TO COVER THE ASPHALT.  THE LIQUID ASPHALT WAS SPREAD OVER THE ASPHALT ROADWAY TO DRY. THIS SEALED THE ROADWAY WITH THE DRAINAGE TO BE CLEANED LATER.
additional_info: CLEAN-UP FOR THE DRAINAGE DITCH WAS BEING HANDLED BETWEEN THE PIMA COUNTY PUBLIC WORKS AND RESPONSIBLE PARTY.  PIMA COUNTY OEM WAS TO BE NOTIFIED IF THE CLEAN-UP DID NOT OCCUR.  IT IS PRESUMED THAT THE CLEAN-UP DID OCCUR AS NO CONTACT WAS MADE TO OEM.

description_of_incident: A DRIVER WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN A TRACTOR TRAILER AROUND. HE BACKED INTO AN OPEN SPACE. HE WAS PULLING FORWARD TO REPOSITION TRUCK. THE RIGHT REAR TIRES OF THE TRAILER CAME OFF THE ROADWAY OVER A 6' DEEP DRAINAGE AREA. THE WEIGHT OF THE MOSTLY LOADED TRAILER PULLED THE TRAILER DOWN CAUSING IT TO ROLL ONTO ITS RIGHT SIDE. INITIAL INDICATIONS ARE  THAT THE DRIVER MAY NOT HAVE SECURED THE CARGO LID. APPROXIMATELY 2000 GALLONS OF A NON HAZARDOUS LIQUID ASPHALT SPILLED OUT. THIS RAN DOWN THE DRAINAGE AREA AND INTO A CREEK & HOLDING POND. ESTIMATES ARE 500-1500 GAL STAYED ON GROUND AND 500-1500 WENT INTO THE CREEK. THE HOLDING POND IS ACTUALLY A 25' X 30' AREA OF WATER HELD BACK BY A NATURAL BEAVER DAM. IT APPEARS MUCH/MOST OF THE OIL WAS CONTAINED HERE.
incident_location: 13 MILES EAST OF CUBA, NM ON STATE ROUTE 126
desc_remedial_action: NMDOT BLOCKED DRAINAGE INTO CREEK WITH GRAVEL. HOLDING POND BLOCKED WITH HAY BAILS AND DIRT BY FOREST SVC.EPA AND FOREST SERVICE SUPERVISING CLEAN UP. CACTUS TRANSPORT PERFORMING SELF CLEAN UP. REMOVE OIL FROM DIRT  AND PUMP HOLDING POND
additional_info: NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION PROVIDED.

description_of_incident: FUEL TANKER CRASHED ON THE SHOULDER OF HIGHWAY AND BURST INTO FLAMES. TOOK PARKER FIRE 3 HOURS TO RESCUE THE DRIVER FROM THE BURNING AREA. FIRE DEPARTMENT USED APPROX 80,000 GALLONS OF WATER TO KEEP THE TRUCK CAB COOL DURING THE RESCUE. DRIVER SUFFERED BROKEN WRIST AND BROKEN PELVIS. ONCE THE DRIVER WAS EXTRACTED THE FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS ORDERED BY THE ON SCENE STATE OFFICIAL TO LET THE TAKER BURN OUT ON ITS OWN. THE SCENE WAS CAPPED WITH SAND AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT WAS CONTAINED UNTIL THE CLEANUP CONTRACTOR CAN OBTAIN THE PROPER PERMITS AND A CLEANUP ACTION LEVEL FROM THE GEOLOGIST THAT WAS ALSO ON SCENE.
desc_remedial_action: REMOVED FREE LIQUIDS FROM SOIL. CAPPED WITH 40 TONS OF SAND TO SUPPRESS VAPORS. DYKED AND BERMED SENSITIVE AREAS  GENERATING A CLEANUP ACTION PLAN AND REMOBILIZING AT A LATER DATE TO INITIATE CLEANUP ACTIVITIES
additional_info: ****WEB REPORT****  NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION PROVIDED.

THEY ARE IN THE PROCESS OF TRANSFERRING THE GASOLINE INTO ANOTHER STORAGE TANK AND ADDING WATER TO HELP STOP THE RELEASE. CALLER ADDED THAT THE FIRE DEPARTMENT ALSO USED FOAM BLANKETS.
desc_remedial_action: SHUT DOWN FACILITY, VALVES CLOSED, TRANSFERRING MATERIAL, WATER ADDED, AND FOAM BLANKETS APPLIED. ROAD CLOSURE IS FOR PRECAUTION.
additional_info: NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.

description_of_incident: THERE WAS A MERCURY SPILL AT THE SITE RESIDENCE.  APPEARS VANDALS SMASHED UP TO 20 MERCURY CONTAINING THERMOMETERS AT THE HOME .THE PROPERTY IS A RESIDENTIAL SINGLE-FAMILY BANK-OWNED HOME. _x000D_THE SPILL WAS DISCOVERED BY A REAL-ESTATE AGENT THAT ARRIVED ONSITE_x000D_, THE AGENT NOTICED THE MERCURY SPILL AND CALLED 911. THE AGENTS SHOES AND VEHICLE FLOOR MATS ARE BAGGED ON SITE_x000D_. THE INTERIOR OF THE HOUSE MAY BE IMPACTED AND THIS WILL NEED TO BE ASSESSED BY THE OWNER (BANK) AFTER OUTDOOR WORK IS COMPLETE._x000D_ EL MIRAGE FIRE DEPARTMENT HAZMAT TEAM ARRIVED ONSITE  AND  WILL BE FUNDING THE INITIAL CLEAN UP AS IT IS A PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUE._x000D_ (THE BANK WILL LIKELY BE HELD FINANCIALLY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE CLEAN UP_x000D_). HAZMAT TEAM (KARY ENVIRONMENTAL) IS ON SITE. THE MERCURY CONTAMINATION HAS BEEN REPORTED TO COVER A ROUGHLY 20 X 20 AREA IN THE FRONT YARD_x000D_ (THE AREA INCLUDES THE WALKWAY, YARD, AND BRICK PORCH AREA_x000D_). CREW IS ONSITE CURRENTLY SECURING THE AREA WITH PERSONNEL AND WILL NOT LEAVE UNTIL THE AREA IS SECURED WITH TEMPORARY FENCING_x000D_. THE 3RD PARTY ENVIRONMENTAL CONSULTANT WILL BE ON SITE TOMORROW MORNING WITH MERCURY VAPOR ANALYZERS TO BETTER DEFINE THE AREA OF IMPACT AND TO WRITE A SCOPE OF REMEDIATION._x000D_ REMEDIATION IS SLATED TO BEGIN FRIDAY AND WILL CONTINUE MONDAY, TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY OF NEXT WEEK AS NEEDED._x000D_
desc_remedial_action: SITE IS A VACANT BANK OWNED HOME. LOCAL FIRE DEPT ON SCENE. LOCAL PRIVATE HAZ-MAT TEAM RETAINED. AREA BEING SECURED WITH TEMP FENCING. 3RD PARTY CONSULTANT RETAINED. WORK SCHEDULED.
additional_info: *** THIS REPORT WAS RECEIVED VIA THE WEB REPORTING SYSTEM- NRC***

description_of_incident: AT 1930 HOURS ON 6/26/11, THE PROPERTY OWNER DISCOVERED THE 500 GALLON PROPANE TANK LEAKING PROPANE AT THE RELIEF VALVE.  HE CALLED THE PROPANE COMPANY, THE MESCAL AND BENSON FIRE DEPARTMENTS.  THE TECHNICIAN EXAMINED THE VALVE, BEGAN TO IDENTIFY THE PROBLEM WITH THE VALVE, ATTEMPTED TO REPAIR THE VALVE AND THE LEAK INCREASED.  THE TECHNICIAN LEFT THE SCENE TO GET THE NECESSARY MATERIALS AND TOOLS.  THE FIRE DEPARTMENT EVACUATED HOMES WITHIN A 1/2 MILE RADIUS OF THE LEAK AND REMAINED ON THE SCENE THE ENTIRE NIGHT.  THE AMERICAN RED CROSS WAS CONTACTED AT 0430 WHEN A SHELTER WAS REQUESTED TO BE OPENED FOR THE PEOPLE EVACUATED.  THE PROPANE COMPANY TECHNICIAN RETURNED TO  THE SCENE AT 0940 ON 6/27/11.  BY 1015, THE TECHNICIAN HAD COMPLETE CONTROL OF THE LEAK, THE SCENE WAS SECURED, AND THE PEOPLE EVACUATED WERE ALLOWED TO RETURN TO THEIR HOMES.
incident_location: 16530 OSAGE TRAIL, MESCAL, PIMA COUNTY, ARIZONA
desc_remedial_action: MONITORED AREA, MONITORED THE HOMES CLOSE TO THE ESCAPING LPG.  TOOK TANK LEVEL READINGS AND TEMPERATURE READING EVERY HOUR UNTIL THE LEAK WAS SECURED.  THE LEAK WAS THE RELIEF VALVE.
additional_info: PIMA COUNTY OEM WAS NOTIFIED OF THE RELEASE AT 2348 ON 6/26/11...NO ACTION OR RESOURCES WERE REQUESTED.   AT 0418 ON 6/27/11, THE REQUEST FOR A SHELTER WAS MADE TO THE ON-CALL OEM.  AFTER CONTACTING THE AMERICAN RED CROSS AND MAKING THE NECESSARY ARRANGEMENTS, THE ON-CALL OEM WENT TOT HE SCENE TO HELP COORDINATE NEEDS.  PIMA COUNTY SHERIFF DEPARTMENT WAS ON SCENE AS WAS THE BENSON AND MECAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS.  THE ON-CALL OEM LEFT THE SCENE WHEN THE LEAK WAS SECURED AND THE AMERICAN RED CROSS WAS CONTACTED, ADVISING THEM OF THE SITUATION.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A CALL WAS RECEIVED ABOUT 7 SUSPICIOUS 55 GALLON DRUMS THAT WERE LEFT IN THE PARKING GARAGE AT BANNER DESERT HOSPITAL. BOMB SQUAD, FIRE DEPT AND LOCAL OFFICIALS ARRIVED ONSCENE AND X-RAYED THE DRUMS. A HAZMAT COMPANY ALSO ARRIVED ONSCENE AND DISCOVERED THAT THE CONTENTS WERE CRUSHED FLUORESCENT BULBS. THE CALLER STATED THAT DRUMS WERE LABELED HONEY. APPARENTLY, THE COMPANY WAS HIRED TO CHANGE ALL OF THE T12 BULBS IN THE HOSPITAL AND THEN LEFT THE DRUMS UNSECURED. THE HOSPITAL WAS EVACUATED ABOVE THE PARKING GARAGE  (ROUGHLY 150 PEOPLE) FOR SEVERAL HOURS.
desc_remedial_action: AN ENVIRONMENTAL COMPANY HAS BEEN HIRED (KARY ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES). THE CONTRACTOR WILL RE-SECURE THE DRUMS AND MARKED THEM AS HAZMAT.
additional_info: CALLER HAD NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION AT THIS TIME.

additional_info: PARTIAL ROAD CLOSURE FOR ABOUT 3 HOURS.

description_of_incident: A KNIGHT TRANSPORTATION TRACTOR TRAILER BROKE A FUEL LINE WHICH RESULTED IN THE RELEASE OF APPROXIMATELY 90 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL.  THE DIESEL FUEL IMPACTED AN AREA OF SOIL AND ROAD SIDE DITCH WHICH CONTAINED STANDING WATER ADJACENT TO THE ROADWAY.  THE AREA OF DITCH LINE IMPACTED BY THE DIESEL FUEL IS APPROXIMATELY 2 MILES FROM A NEARBY UNNAMED CREEK.
desc_remedial_action: KNIGHT TRANSPORTATION CONTACTED ERTS TO OVERSEE ENVIRONMENTAL OPERATIONS.  ENVIRONMENTAL HAZMAT WAS DISPATCHED TO THE SITE BY LOCAL REGULATORY AGENCY ON SITE. ABSORBENT PADS HAVE BEEN UTILIZED TO COLLECT THE FUEL FROM THE DITCH.
additional_info: ***WEB REPORT*** NO ADDITIONAL INFORMATION REPORTED.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATES THERE IS A MOBILE HOME THAT DOES NOT HAVE A SEPTIC TANK HOOKED UP AND THERE IS RAW SEWAGE SPILLING ONTO THE GROUND.  THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ONGOING FOR A WEEK.
desc_remedial_action: CALLER IS MAKING NOTIFICATIONS.
additional_info: CALLER DESCRIBED THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF MATERIAL INVOLVED IN THE RELEASE AS "QUITE A BIT".

additional_info: CALLER ALSO NOTIFIED THE PARISH (REPORT NUMBER [2011-27855] WAS ISSUED). CALLER WILL NOTIFY THE LA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY.

description_of_incident: A CONCRETE MIXING TRUCK BLEW IT'S PASSENGER SIDE TIRE WHILE TRAVELING SOUTH BOUND AZ-101 CAUSING THE TRUCK TO HIT THE CONCRETE WALL WHERE THE TRUCK ROLLED OVER THE WALL AND CAUGHT FIRE. THE FUEL TANK CAUGHT FIRE BURNING MOST OF THE FUEL BUT WHILE CONDUCTING FIRE FIGHTING PROCEDURES THE WATER RUN OFF POSSIBLY CONTAMINATED WITH FUEL COULD HAVE ENTERED THE STORM DRAIN. AN ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION HAZMAT TECHNICIAN WAS ON SCENE, SOUTHWEST HAZARD CONTROL WILL CONDUCT THE CLEAN UP
incident_location: SOUTH BOUND AZ STATE ROUTE 101 AT MILE POST 32
desc_remedial_action: SOCKS AND PADS WERE USED TO SUCK UP ANY FUEL/OIL OUT OF THE WATER PRIOR TO REACHING THE STORM DRAIN AND MICROBLAZE WILL BE PLACED IN THE STORM DRAIN (WHICH IS DRY) TO BREAK DOWN ANY HYDROCARBONS THAT MAY HAVE BEEN RELEASED.
additional_info: ****WEB REPORT*****

description_of_incident: ***RECEIVED VIA NRC WEB*** A TRACTOR TRAILER WAS INVOLVED IN A ROLLOVER WHICH RESULTED IN THE RELEASE OF AN ESTIMATED 200 GALLONS OF SODIUM HYDROXIDE. ERTS WAS CONTACTED TO OVERSEE ENVIRONMENTAL OPERATIONS. CUSTOM ENVIRONMENTAL WAS HIRED TO THE SITE FOR REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES.
desc_remedial_action: KNIGHT TRANSPORTATION WAS CONTACTED TO OVERSEE ENVIRONMENTAL OPERATIONS.  ERTS DISPATCHED CUSTOM ENVIRONMENTAL TO THE SITE FOR REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES.
additional_info: ***WEB REPORT*** COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT HAS BEEN NOTIFIED OF THE INCIDENT AND A TRACKING NUMBER IS YET TO BE ASSIGNED.

description_of_incident: ***WEB REPORT*** A 300 GALLON STAINLESS STEEL TOTE FELL FROM THE BACK OF TRAILER BEING PULLED FROM LOADING DOCK.  APPROXIMATELY 66 GALLONS OF THE WASTE FLAMMABLE LIQUID (CARRYING EPA D001 WASTE CODE) SPILLED INTO THE COATED SECONDARY CONTAINMENT OF THE DOCK BAY.  THE SPILLED MATERIAL WAS CONTAINED INSIDE THE COATED CONTAINMENT AREA AND CLEANED UP IMMEDIATELY.   THERE WAS NO RELEASE TO THE SOIL OR WATERWAYS.
desc_remedial_action: THE SPILLED MATERIAL WAS CONTAINED INSIDE THE COATED CONTAINMENT AREA AND CLEANED UP IMMEDIATELY.

description_of_incident: APPROX. 1 GAL OR 10 POUNDS OF TAR LIKE SUBSTANCE ASSUMED TO BE BETWEEN 150,000 AND 175,000 PPM PCB SPILLED AT SULPHUR SPRINGS VALLEY ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE (SSVEC) TECHNICAL SERVICES MAINTENANCE YARD. PCB CONTENT ASSUMPTION, DUE TO PREVIOUS TESTING OF SIMILAR SUBSTANCE. A SAMPLE WAS SENT TO A LAB.  IT COVERED AN AREA ABOUT 3 BY 4 FEET. ONLY PENETRATED A FEW INCHES DEEP, DUE TO BEING A THICK SUBSTANCE. SPILL WAS CLEANED UP AND PLACED INTO DRUMS FOR STORAGE AND DISPOSAL, SITE SECURED FOR FUTURE SOIL TESTING.  LEAKING EQUIPMENT CONTAINED AND SECURED FOR STORAGE AND DISPOSAL.  LOCATION IS A DRY DESERT LOT THAT IS NOT VISITED BY PUBLIC, ONLY EMPLOYEES. THE SPILL QUANTITY AND CONTENT WAS NOT A REPORTABLE EPA QUANTITY PER 40 CFR 761. IT WAS 10 LBS OR LESS OF PURE PCB. I CALLED NRC AND THEY COULD NOT TELL ME IF REPORTABLE FOR CERCLA,  SO I WENT AHEAD AND FILLED OUT THE REPORT JUST IN CASE.
desc_remedial_action: REMOVED SOIL WITH TAR SUBSTANCE AND A BUFFER AREA, PLACED IN DRUM FOR STORAGE AND DISPOSAL. SAME FOR LEAKING ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT.

description_of_incident: A MULTIPLE VEHICLE ACCIDENT CAUSED THE RELEASE OF APPROXIMATELY 50 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL ONTO THE ROADWAY. APPROXIMATELY 5 GALLONS OF THE FUEL HAS IMPACTED A NEARBY STORM DRAIN. A NETWORK CONTRACTOR HAS BEEN DISPATCHED TO THE LOCATION WITH A VACUUM TRUCK FOR CLEANUP.
desc_remedial_action: ENVIRONMENTAL CONTRACTOR DISPATCHED TO THE SITE WITH A VACUUM TRUCK TO REMOVE THE FUEL FROM THE IMPACTED STORM DRAIN.

description_of_incident: APPROX. 32 GALLONS OF 2-ETHYL-2-OXAZOLINE WAS RELEASED INTO SECONDARY CONTAINMENT WHEN A VALVE LEFT OPEN OVER THE WEEKEND CREATED A SIPHON EFFECT AND OVERFILLED A TOTE. AND THE ESTIMATED QUANTITY OF VAPORS EMITTED WAS LESS THAN 100 LBS.
desc_remedial_action: VALVE SHUT.  MATERIAL RECOVERED FROM SECONDARY CONTAINMENT.
additional_info: THE DURATION OF THE RELEASE IS ESTIMATED FROM THE TIME OF THE ODOR COMPLAINT UNTIL CLEANUP BEGAN.  THE WIND WAS GUSTY FOR MOST OF THAT TIME AND IT RAINED.  THE RATE OF RELEASE OF VAPORS CAN BE CALCULATED IF NECESSARY.  ***WEB REPORT***

description_of_incident: ***WEB REPORT*** THERE WAS A RELEASE OF HYDROGEN SULFIDE IN COMBINATION WITH CARBON DISULFIDE DUE TO THE INADVERTENT MIXING OF TWO CHEMICALS IN A STORAGE TANK.   A STORAGE TANK WITH CONTAINS SODIUM TRITHIOCARBONATE WAS INADVERTENTLY FILLED FROM A TRUCK CONTAINING A PHOSPHONIC ACID SALT SOLUTION WHICH WAS INTENDED FOR A DIFFERENT STORAGE TANK.  A CHEMICAL REACTION RESULTED FROM THE MIXTURE OF THE TWO CHEMICALS.   THIS CHEMICAL REACTION HAS THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE HYDROGEN SULFIDE AND CARBON DISULFIDE DEPENDING ON THE PH OF THE RESULTING SOLUTION.   HYDROGEN SULFIDE WAS DETECTED IN THE AREA AND INSIDE THE STORAGE TANK.   THE AMOUNT OF THE RELEASE IS NOT ABLE TO BE QUANTIFIED AT THIS TIME BUT MAY BE GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO THE RQ AMOUNT FOR HYDROGEN SULFIDE AND/OR CARBON DISULFIDE.
incident_location: CORONADO GENERATING STATION - UNIT 1 ABSORBER BUILDING
location_street1: HWY 191 7 MILES N OF ST. JOHNS
desc_remedial_action: SOME OF THE MIXTURE OF THE TWO CHEMICALS WAS PUMPED INTO TOTE BINS WHICH ARE BEING HELD ON SITE PENDING TESTING.   THE REMAINING MATERIAL IN THE TANK WAS DILUTED AND PUMPED INTO THE SO2 ABSORBER WHERE THE SODIUM TRI THIOSULFATE IS USED.
additional_info: ***WEB REPORT*** NEITHER OF THE CHEMICALS INVOLVED WAS RELEASED.  THE MIXED CHEMICALS WERE CONFINED TO A TANK.   A REACTION IN THE TANK CAUSED AN UNKNOWN QUANTITY AIR RELEASE OF CHEMICALS (HYDROGEN SULFIDE AND CARBON DISULFIDE) WHICH MAY BE EVOLVED BY ACIDIFICATION OF THE SODIUM TRITHIOCARBONATE SOLUTION.  WE HAVE DISCUSSED THIS EVENT AT LENGTH WITH THE CHEMICAL VENDOR TO DETERMINE IF AN RQ RELEASE OCCURRED OR NOT. WE HAVE DETERMINED THAT CONDITIONS MAY HAVE EXISTED THAT COULD HAVE CAUSED THE EVOLUTION OF HYDROGEN SULFIDE AND CARBON DISULFIDE GAS.   THESE GASES MAY HAVE BEEN RELEASED IN QUANTITIES EQUAL TO OR GREATER THAN THE RQ.   HOWEVER, FURTHER INVESTIGATION MAY REVEAL THAT THE QUANTITIES ARE LESS THAN THE RQ.  WE ARE MAKING THIS REPORT IN CASE THE QUANTITIES ARE SHOWN TO EXCEED THE RQ IN OUR ON-GOING INVESTIGATION.
state_agency_notified: ADEQ SPILL LINE WILL BE CONTACTED

description_of_incident: SUSPECTED RESPONSIBLE PARTY HAS RELEASED A LARGE QUANTITY OF SPRAY HERBICIDE INTO THE AIR. THE ODOR IS CAUSING PROBLEMS LOCALLY.

description_of_incident: ****WEB REPORT**** DFD WAS CALLED BY WAL-MART LOSS PREVENTION PERSONNEL IN REFERENCE TO A POSSIBLE DIESEL SPILL IN THEIR PARKING LOT. DFD RESPONDED AND FOUND A SLICK OF OIL OR DIESEL FUEL WHICH THEY SAID HAD LEAKED OUT OF A TRUCK WHICH WAS NO LONGER AT THE STORE.  ANOTHER CAR WAS PARKED IN THE SPOT AND THEY WERE WORRIED ABOUT POSSIBLE IGNITION OR DAMAGE TO THE NEW CAR.  DFD USED A COMMERCIAL ABSORBENT TO CLEAN UP WHAT WAS LEFT OF THE SPILL, WHICH WAS LESS THAN 1 LITER. THE SPILL HAD RUN INTO A STORM DRAIN, BUT WAS NO LONGER FLOWING AND IT DID NOT APPEAR THAT MUCH HAD GOTTEN INTO THE DRAIN.  CITY OF DOUGLAS PUBLIC WORKS WAS CONTACTED AND ADVISED OF THE SITUATION IN CASE THEY WANTED TO INVESTIGATE FURTHER.  THE ABSORBENT AND MATERIAL WERE SWEPT UP (APPROXIMATELY .5 CUBIC FEET OF MATERIAL) AND TAKEN BACK TO DFD FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.
incident_location: DOUGLAS WAL-MART PARKING LOT ROM 8/9 NEAR STORM DRAIN
desc_remedial_action: COVERED SPILL ON LAND WITH ABORBENT AND SWEPT IT UP AND REMOVED IT. CALLED PUBLIC WORKS WITH INFORMATION SO THAT THEY COULD BE AWARE TO BE WATCHING FOR ANY MATERIAL OR CHECK THE DRAIN IN THE AREA.
additional_info: ****WEB REPORT****  IT IS NOT CLEAR HOW MUCH MATERIAL LEAKED, 1 GALLON IS A BEST ESTIMATE BASED ON THE CONDITIONS FOUND ON SCENE.  IT COULD BE MORE OR LESS.

description_of_incident: ***WEB REPORT*** SEMI TRUCK CRASHED AND LOST 150 GALLONS OF DIESEL INTO A STORM DRAIN THAT FEEDS TO THE HASSAYAMPA RIVER.
incident_location: US 60 @ US 93 JUNCTION 1ST ROUNDABOUT IN TOWN

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A RELEASE OF APPROXIMATELY 50 GALLONS OF DIESEL ONTO A ROADWAY FROM A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK WHEN A DRIVER RAN OVER A TIRE IN THE ROAD DAMAGING THE FUEL LINE.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT SOMEONE DUMPED APPROXIMATELY 50 GALLONS OF USED MOTOR OIL ONTO THE GROUND IN A DIRT ALLEY.

description_of_incident: ****WEB REPORT**** HOSE MALFUNCTION ON DIESEL FUEL PUMP AND APPROXIMATELY 40 TO 50 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL WERE RELEASED PRIOR TO GETTING THE PUMP TURNED OFF. THE RELEASED FUEL FLOWED OFF OF THE CONCRETE PAD TO AN AREA OF HARD PACKED SOIL. IT SPREAD OVER AN AREA OF LESS THAN 400 SQUARE FEET.
desc_remedial_action: SOIL THAT WAS EXPOSED TO THE FUEL IS BEING REMOVED AND STORED ON AN IMPERMEABLE BARRIER. THE DAMAGE TO THE FUEL HOSE IS BEING REPAIRED.
additional_info: THE SURFACE AREA WHERE THE RELEASE OCCURRED IS HARD PACKED SOIL AND HAS A VERY LOW PERMEABILITY. THE RELEASED FUEL DOES NOT APPEAR TO HAVE GONE MORE THAN AN INCH OR SO BELOW THE SURFACE. *****WEB REPORT****

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING A RELEASE OF INDUSTRIAL GARBAGE INTO A STORM DRAIN.  THE CALLER STATED THAT A GARBAGE TRUCK CAUGHT ON FIRE.  THE CALLER STATED THAT THE WATER USED BY THE FIRE DEPARTMENT TO PUT OUT THE FIRE WASHED SOME OF THE MATERIAL INTO THE STORM DRAIN.

M/V SEABIRD IS CURRENTLY AGROUND WITH HIGH TIDE COMING UP OVER THE STERN. NRC AND ADEC NOTIFIED FURTHER ACTION PENDING. ON SCENE WEATHER WAS 35 F, MOSTLY CLOUDY, WINDS E 6KTS AND SEA STATE WAVES 1'. LAT/LONG: 58 6' 12" N / 135 27' 2" W
desc_remedial_action: 500 FOOT OF BOOM DEPLOYED FOR CONTAINMENT. SORBENT PADS WERE PLACED INSIDE THE SKIN OF THE SHIP.

AZ DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WAS NOTIFIED WITH IN 24 HOURS OF INCIDENT ON 4-DEC-15 AT 0930 HRS". CALLER ALSO REPORTS "THAT AGENCY DOES NOT HAVE RECORD OF THAT CONTACT. FURTHER CONTACT WAS MADE 10-DEC-15 WHERE DIRECTION TO MAKE A REPORT WITH THE NRC WAS COMMUNICATED TO THE CITY OF SCOTTSDALE ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT".

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT THEY LOST ALL OF THEIR GAS PRESSURE AT THREE DIFFERENT REG STATIONS AND THEY GOT TO A LOW PRESSURE SITUATION SO THEY TURNED IT OFF FOR SAFETY. THERE IS A POTENTIAL RELEASE OF NATURAL GAS TO THE AIR.

AT APPROXIMATELY 0918MST, A TANKER TRUCK ROLLED-OVER WHILE MAKING A TURN ON US-60. AS A RESULT CARGO WAS BREACHED AND APPROXIMATELY 3500 GALLONS OF A UN3255 ASPHALT (HOT ASPHALT) RELEASED ONTO THE ROADWAY, INTO A STORM DRAIN AND ROAD-SIDE CANAL/DITCH (APPROX. 2500 GALLONS INTO THE CANAL). NO INJURIES OR FIRES REPORTED. US-60 WESTBOUND LANES HAVE BEEN CLOSED.
desc_remedial_action: STORM DRAIN CONTAINED, CURRENTLY TRYING TO OFFLOAD PRODUCT FROM THE TANKER. ALL PRODUCT WILL REMAIN IN THE CANAL FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. REMEDIATION PENDING.
additional_info: * THERE IS LOCAL MEDIA COVERAGE FOR THIS INCIDENT. * NO FEDERAL ASSISTANCE IS BEING REQUESTED; STATE ONSCENE.

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING A DISCHARGE OF GASOLINE AND DIESEL FUEL DUE TO A TANKER TRUCK ROLL OVER (OFF ROAD).  THE CALLER STATED THE TRUCK IGNITED ON FIRE DUE TO THE INCIDENT.  THE CALLER STATED THE DRIVER SUFFERED MINOR INJURIES DUE TO THE ACCIDENT.  CALLER STATED THE TANKER TRUCK HAD 6000 GALLONS OF GASOLINE AND 2000 DIESEL FUEL ON BOARD, THE AMOUNT SPILLED OF BOTH PRODUCTS IS UNKNOWN.  THE IMPACTS ARE SOIL AND THE RIO GRANDE.

additional_info: **CALLER HAD LIMITED INFORMATION AT THE TIME OF THE REPORT. ROAD CLOSURE: UNKNOWN HOW LONG THE ROAD WAS OR HAS BEEN CLOSED FOR.

CALLER STATED THERE WERE OTHER MATERIALS INVOLVED BUT THEY ARE UNABLE TO IDENTIFY THEM AT THIS TIME DUE TO THE FIRE.

description_of_incident: THE RP IS REPORTING A DISCHARGE OF UNLEADED GASOLINE AND DIESEL FUEL DUE TO TANKER TRUCK GOING OFF ROAD.  RP STATED THAT THE DRIVER OF THE TANKER TRUCK WENT OFF ROAD TO AVOID BEING HIT BY A FLATBED TRUCK VEERING INTO THEIR LANE.  RP STATED THE FLAT BED TRUCK CLIPPED TANKER AND THE TANKER WAS DAMAGED AFTER GOING OFF ROAD.  THE IMPACTS ARE SOIL AND ROADWAY. **NO REPORTED INJURIES AT THIS TIME. ***NO REPORTED ROAD CLOSURES, FIRES, OR EVACUATIONS AT THIS TIME. ***RP STATED THE AMOUNT OF GASOLINE DISCHARGED IS BETWEEN 2-3,000 GALLONS AND APPROXIMATELY 1,000 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL (GROUND ONLY).
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR (SOUTHWEST HAZARD CONTROL) HAS BEEN HIRED AND ARE ENROUTE. CREWS ON SITE TO TRANSFER THE REMAINING FUEL FROM THE TANKER TRUCK.

description_of_incident: GASOLINE DISCHARGED FROM A BIG MOTOR HOME GAS TANK DUE TO OPERATOR ERROR (RESPONSIBLE PARTY MOVED THE TANK AND IT WAS NOT SECURED).
desc_remedial_action: NONE
additional_info: CALLER IS CONCERNED THE INCIDENT COULD CAUSE A FIRE.

description_of_incident: 10,000 - 15,000 GALLONS OF IRRIGATION WATER (AFFLUENT) RELEASED FROM A 12 INCH PIPELINE DUE TO A BROKEN 2 INCH AIR RELIEF VALVE.
desc_remedial_action: THEY ISOLATED THE PIPELINE AND SHUT OFF ALL FLOW.  REPAIRS WERE MADE.  THEY ALSO VACUUMED OUT THE MANHOLE.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A STORM KNOCKED TWO POLE-MOUNTED TRANSFORMERS TO THE GROUND RESULTING IN THE DISCHARGE OF MINERAL OIL (UNKNOWN IF CONTAINS PCB) ONTO THE GROUND AND INTO A STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: RESPONSE CREWS CONDUCTED CLEAN UP.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A SLUNG EXTERNAL LOAD OF TWO DRUMS ACCIDENTLY RELEASED AND FELL TO THE GROUND RELEASING 90 GALLONS OF GASOLINE ONTO THE GROUND (TRIBAL LAND).
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTORS NOTIFIED

description_of_incident: MIXTURE OF DIESEL FUEL AND MOTOR OIL DISCHARGED FROM A COMMERCIAL VEHICLE DUE A SINGLE VEHICLE ACCIDENT ASSOCIATED WITH HEAVY WEATHER CONDITIONS.
desc_remedial_action: THEY STOPPED THE LEAK AT THE TANK.

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING THAT 2 HOUSES ARE BEING DEMOLISHED.  THEY CONTAIN ASBESTOS AND LEAD PAINT AND IT DOES NOT APPEAR THAT PROPER PRECAUTIONS ARE BEING TAKEN TO MAKE SURE THAT MATERIAL DOESN'T GET INTO THE ENVIRONMENT. YESTERDAY THEY WERE USING A WATER TRUCK TO KEEP THE DUST DOWN BUT TODAY THERE IS NO WATER TRUCK.
desc_remedial_action: NOTIFICATIONS.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED AN UNKNOWN AMOUNT OF REFRIGERANT (R410A) RELEASED FROM A CHILLER ON THE 2ND FLOOR ROOF OF A BUILDING INTO THE AIR. CALLER STATED A SMALL AMOUNT POSSIBLY RELEASED INSIDE OF THE BUILDING AS WELL.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR WAS CALLED TO FIND OUT WHAT CAUSED THE CHILLER TO BREAK DOWN, REMAINING REFRIGERANT WILL BE REMOVED FROM THE CHILLER TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT RELEASED.

description_of_incident: A COMMERCIAL VEHICLE COLLIDED WITH ANOTHER VEHICLE, WHICH RESULTED IN THE TRACTOR TRAILER CRASHING INTO A WASH. AS A RESULT OF IMPACT, THE TRUCK IGNITED ON FIRE, RELEASED FUEL (APPROX. 40 GALLONS) FROM ITS SADDLE TANKS AND ENGINE FLUIDS. CARGO ALSO CONSISTED OF GROUND MEAL, WITH MAJORITY OF THE PRODUCT BURNING OFF IN THE FIRE. ONE MINOR INJURY REPORTED; UNKNOWN IF THE SUBJECT WAS TRANSPORTED TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL. ROAD SHOULDER WAS/IS CLOSED FOR 4-5 HOURS FOR CLEAN-UP.
desc_remedial_action: TOW TRUCK IS ONSCENE ASSISTING WITH CLEAN-UP.

description_of_incident: CALLER REPORTS A DISCHARGE OF AN UNKNOWN AMOUNT OF REFRIGERANT OIL ONTO THE GROUND IN A PARKING LOT AFTER THE SUSPECTED RESPONSIBLE PARTY KNOCKED OVER A 30 GALLON DRUM.
desc_remedial_action: CALLER REPORTS THE SUSPECTED RESPONSIBLE PARTY PLACED CAT LITTER ON THE AFFECTED AREA IN THE PARKING LOT.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT APPROXIMATELY 10 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL DISCHARGED ONTO THE GROUND AND GRASS OF A FUELING STATION DURING A LOADING EVENT.
desc_remedial_action: MATERIAL CONTAINED,CLEAN UP UNDERWAY,CONTRACTOR HAS BEEN HIRED

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT APPROXIMATELY HALF OF A GALLON OF JET-A FUEL WAS DISCHARGED FROM AN AIRCRAFT, ONTO PAVEMENT, AND REACHED A STORM DRAIN, DUE TO A FAILED VALVE.  THE DISCHARGE WAS STOPPED INSIDE THE STORM DRAIN, AND DID NOT REACH THE SALT RIVER.
desc_remedial_action: CALLER STATED THEY PUMPED THE JET FUEL FROM THE STORM DRAIN AND DEPLOYED ABSORBENTS AND MICROBLAZE.

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING THAT THERE IS A PARTIAL BREACH OF THE INTERNATIONAL OUTPUT INTERCEPTER (SEWAGE LINE) WHICH RUNS FROM MEXICO TO THE US.  THIS IS CAUSING THE RELEASE OF UNTREATED SEWAGE (THE MAJORITY OF WHICH ORDINATES IN MEXICO AND MAY CONTAIN HEAVY METALS OR OTHER HAZARDOUS MATERIAL) INTO A CREEK LOCATED IN THE US.
desc_remedial_action: THE CALLER STATES THAT THE EMERGENCY OPERATIONS CENTER HAS BEEN ACTIVATED.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT WHILE MAKING A DELIVERY THE OPERATOR OVERFILLED THE STORAGE TANK THEY WERE OFFLOADING TO.  THERE WAS A DISCHARGE OF APPROXIMATELY 1100 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTORS ONSITE PERFORMING CLEANUP.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT A SEMI TRACTOR TRAILER WAS GOING OVER RAIL ROAD TRACKS WHEN THE DRIVE SHAFT ON THE VEHICLE WAS PUSHED BACK CAUSING DIESEL FUEL TO RELEASE TO THE GROUND.
incident_location: CROSS STREETS: SW PARKWAY & S. PINE WOOD STREETS
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR IS ON SITE APPLYING OIL DRY TO THE AREA FOR REMEDIATION.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT A TRANSFORMER CAUGHT FIRE WHICH SET OFF THE FIRE SUPPRESSANT SYSTEM.  THE SYSTEM CAUSED THE RELEASED TRANSFORMER OIL (NON PCB) TO FLOW INTO A DRAINAGE DITCH.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR ON SITE, BOOM AND HAY BAILS IN PLACE.  EXCAVATION WILL TAKE PLACE.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK CAUGHT FIRE RESULTING IN THE POTENTIAL RELEASE OF DIESEL FUEL AND OIL. THERE ARE NO SIGNS OF A RELEASE AT THIS TIME.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR EN ROUTE TO ASSESS SITUATION.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING CONTRACTORS DAMAGED A FITTING WHILE CONDUCTING MAINTENANCE, RESULTING IN A RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.
desc_remedial_action: REPAIRS UNDERWAY, RELEASE SECURED

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING THAT CRASHED CARS AT THE LOT ARE LEAKING OIL AND COOLANT IN THE SOIL AND GROUND WATER.
CALLER STATED THERE WAS A SPILL OF DIESEL AND COOLANT FROM A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK DUE TO A HEAD ON COLLISION WITH A PASSENGER VEHICLE.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR HAS BEEN HIRED AND ENROUTE

description_of_incident: ***THIS REPORT IS UPDATE TO NRC NO. 1185747 *** THE CALLER WAS ABLE TO CALCULATE THE EXACT AMOUNT OF THE RELEASE AND WANTED TO UPDATE THE ORIGINAL REPORT. THE CALLER IS REPORTING A RELEASE OF 40 POUNDS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA ONTO A GROUND FROM A DAMAGED FITTING. THE CALLER STATED THAT DAMAGE WAS CAUSED BY A CONTRACTOR WHO WAS CONDUCTING MAINTENANCE.
desc_remedial_action: A REPAIR OF THE DAMAGED PART HAS BEEN COMPLETED AND THE SYSTEM IS BACK ONLINE.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT DUE TO A PALLET COLLAPSE, AN ESTIMATED 75 GALLONS OF MATERIAL WAS RELEASED. THE MATERIAL WAS RELEASED ONTO THE CONCRETE FLOOR OF THE WAREHOUSE. THE MATERIAL IS CALLED CLEAN FORCE SOLID DISH MACHINE DETERGENT.
desc_remedial_action: EVACUATIONS, CONTRACTOR ON-SCENE, FD/PD ON SCENE

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT DISCHARGED DIESEL, ENGINE COOLANT AND MOTOR OIL ONTO THE GROUND.  THIS INCIDENT RESULTED IN 02 FATALITIES.
desc_remedial_action: MADE NOTIFICATIONS. CONTRACTOR IS EN ROUTE.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED FOR THE LAST TWO DAYS THERE HAS BEEN A CHEMICAL ODOR IN THE AIR IN A RESIDENTIAL AREA.  CALLER STATED IS SMELLS LIKE A COMBINATION OF CHEMICALS.  CALLER STATED IT IS HARD TO BREATH AND CAUSES A BAD HEADACHE.
incident_location: 36TH STREET AND CLAREDON SOUTH OF INDIAN SCHOOL

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING THAT THE BIODIESEL PUMP LEAKED A COMBINATION OF BIODIESEL AND DIESEL FUEL ONTO THE SHED FLOOR AND THE PARKING LOT SURFACE.
desc_remedial_action: THE CALLER STATES THAT THE TANKS WERE SHUT DOWN AND AN ENVIRONMENTAL CLEAN UP COMPANY IS IN ROUTE.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER DISCHARGED 150 GALLONS OF DIESEL FROM THE SADDLE TANKS OF A TRACTOR TRAILER FOR AN UNKNOWN REASON.
desc_remedial_action: FD/PD ON-SCENE, CONTRACTOR ENROUTE, BOOMS DEPLOYED

description_of_incident: CALLER REPORTS A DISCHARGE OF APPROXIMATELY 30 GALLONS OF HYDRAULIC OIL ONTO A ROADWAY WITH TWO TO THREE GALLONS WASHED INTO A STORM DRAIN CAUSED BY A THREE CAR COLLISION.
desc_remedial_action: CALLER REPORTS ABSORBANT MATERIALS WERE UTILIZED TO CLEAN THE ROADWAY AND ADOT HAZMAT PERSONNEL APPLIED MICROBLAZE INTO THE STORM DRAIN.

description_of_incident: PROPANE RELEASED FROM A HOSE ON THE BACK OF A BOB-TAIL TRUCK WHERE ONE OF THE TIRES CAUGHT ON FIRE AND BURNT THE HOSE.
desc_remedial_action: FIRE DEPT RESPONDED.

description_of_incident: CALLER REPORTS A DISCHARGE OF APPROXIMATELY 65 GALLONS OF MINERAL OIL ONTO THE GROUND AND INTO A CREEK AFTER A POWER POLE WITH THREE TRANSFORMERS FELL OVER DUE TO A FLOOD. THE MINERAL OIL DID NOT CONTAIN PCBS.
desc_remedial_action: CALLER REPORTS THAT AFTER THE AREA WAS DEEMED SAFE, THE TRANSFORMERS WERE  DETACHED AND PLACED UPRIGHT TO PREVENT MORE LEAKING. THE CREEK WASHED ALL THE DISCHARGED MINERAL OIL AWAY.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT DUE TO THE RAIN, A TRUCK WAS INVOLVED IN A SINGLE VEHICLE ACCIDENT,  LOST SADDLE TANK AND SPILLED DIESEL ON THE SANDY RIVER (NO WATER).
desc_remedial_action: THE TRUCK WAS TOWED AWAY. THE MATERIAL IS CONTAINED.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A TRACTOR TRAILER STRUCK A GUARDRAIL, CAUSING THE TRUCK TO ROLL OVER.  INCIDENT RESULTED IN A DISCHARGE OF DIESEL AND MOTOR OIL.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR ON SITE, CLEANUP UNDERWAY.

description_of_incident: CALLER REPORTS A RELEASE OF APPROXIMATELY 5 GALLONS OF TRASH WATER DOWN A STORM DRAIN CAUSED BY AN EMPLOYEE DUMPING IT AT AN AIRPORT.
desc_remedial_action: MADE REPORT.

description_of_incident: A CALLER REPORTED A DISCHARGE OF AN UNKNOWN AMOUNT OF AN UNKNOWN OIL INTO PUGET SOUND FROM A VESSEL DUE TO AN UNKNOWN CAUSE.
location_address: PORT OF SEATTLE AT FISHERMAN'S TERMINAL
desc_remedial_action: ABOUT TO APPLY DIAPERS

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRAIN STRUCK A VEHICLE AT A CROSSING RESULTING IN 1 FATALITY.
desc_remedial_action: INVESTIGATION UNDERWAY

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A DISCHARGE OF GASOLINE FROM A FUEL PUMP AT A GAS STATION ONTO THE GROUND AND INTO A HOLDING POND.  THE CAUSE IS UNKNOWN.
desc_remedial_action: MADE NOTIFICATION. F500 WAS APPLIED.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT 20 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL DISCHARGED ONTO THE STREET AND REACHED A STORM DRAIN WHEN A COMMERCIAL TRUCK CAUGHT FIRE. THE FIRE HAS BEEN EXTINGUISHED.
desc_remedial_action: ABSORBENTS APPLIED,VAC TRUCK USED

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A DECEASED PERSON WAS FOUND NEXT TO THE TRACKS. SPECIFIC TRAIN INVOLVEMENT IN THE INCIDENT IS UNKNOWN.
desc_remedial_action: INVESTIGATION UNDERWAY BY LOCAL POLICE.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATES THERE IS A VERY STRONG TOXIC FUME COMING FROM A LOCAL HOSPITAL CONSTRUCTION SITE THAT IS COVERING A LARGE AREA AND THE CALLER IS CONCERNED FOR THE HEALTH OF NEARBY PRIVATE CITIZENS.  CALLER STATES THE ODOR HAS A VERY STRONG GASOLINE OR DIESEL SMELL.  CALLER ALSO STATES THE PEOPLE IN THE AREA ARE HAVING RESPIRATORY PROBLEMS.  CALLER SUSPECTS THEY ARE PERFORMING TARRING AT THE CONSTRUCTION SITE WHICH MAY BE A CAUSE OF THE STRONG TOXIC FUMES.
incident_location: TUCSON MEDICAL CENTER; AT THE INTERSECTION OF GLENN RD & ROSEMOUNT RD

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMING FROM THE WATER OF A TRAVEL TRAILER (2011 ROCKWOOD, V-NOSE) DUE TO UNKNOWN CAUSES. CALLER STATED A WATER LINE ON THE TRAILER RUPTURED AND RELEASED UNKNOWN MATERIAL ONTO THE GROUND.
desc_remedial_action: NO ACTIONS WERE TAKEN FOR CLEAN UP.

description_of_incident: FREON RELEASED FROM A FREEZER UNIT DUE TO A WORK ACCIDENT (CONSTRUCTION WORKER DRILLED INTO A LINE).
desc_remedial_action: THE LINE WAS PATCHED AND THE REFRIGERANT WAS REPLACED.

description_of_incident: A CALLER REPORTED A DISCHARGE OF AN UNKNOWN AMOUNT OF DIESEL OIL, SPENT MOTOR OIL AND SUSPECTED ANTI-FREEZE MATERIAL INTO THE GROUND FROM AN UNKNOWN SOURCE. THE CALLER STATED THAT THE GROUND WAS FOUND TO BE SATURATED WITH SAID MATERIALS AFTER CONDUCTING A SIMPLE INVESTIGATION WITH A SHOVEL. THE CALLER STATED THAT APPX. 200 SQUARE FEET AREA SEEMS TO BE IMPACTED. THE CALLER IS CONCERNED THAT THE AREA IN QUESTION HAS A SHALLOW UNDERGROUND AQUA FLOW (TYPICALLY 8-10 FEET DEEP) THAT MIGHT'VE BEEN CONTAMINATED.
THE RP IS REPORTING A DISCHARGE OF DIESEL FUEL DUE TO A PUNCTURE ON A SADDLE TANK.  CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT IS CURRENTLY UNKNOWN.  THE IMPACTS ARE ROADWAY AND INTO A STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: CLEAN UP CREW ON-SITE, CONTRACTOR (PATRIOT ENVIRONMENTAL) HAS BEEN HIRED.
additional_info: STORM DRAIN: ESTIMATE THAT 5-10 GALLONS IMPACTED THE DRAIN (UNCONFIRMED).

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING AN UNCONTROLLED MOVEMENT OF TWO RAIL CARS AT A CUSTOMER FACILITY. THE CARS ROLLED INTO A FACILITY GATE.
desc_remedial_action: INVESTIGATION UNDERWAY.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THERE WAS A SPILL OF DIESEL FROM THE SADDLE TANK OF A TRACTOR TRAILER.  THIS WAS DUE TO THE VEHICLE RUNNING INTO A GUARD RAIL.
desc_remedial_action: CALLER STATED ONE SOUTHBOUND LANE IS CLOSED OF THE ROADWAY AND A CONTRACTOR HAS BEEN HIRED FOR CLEAN UP (ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES INC.)

description_of_incident: A CALLER REPORTED A DISCOVERY OF A DECEASED BODY IN A RAILROAD YARD FACILITY. THE CALLER STATED THAT A TRESPASSER'S BODY WAS FOUND AT THE EDGE OF RIGHT OF WAY IN THE FACILITY. THE CAUSE OF THE DEATH IS UNDER INVESTIGATION BUT INITIAL REPORT INDICATES NON-RAILROAD RELATED DEATH.

CALLER STATED AN F-16 AIRCRAFT WENT DOWN AND CRASHED APPROXIMATELY 120 MILES FROM THE BASE DUE TO UNKNOWN CAUSES AT THIS TIME. CALLER STATED THE PILOT WAS FATALITY INJURED. IT WAS UNKNOWN AT THIS TIME HOW MUCH FUEL WAS RELEASED.
incident_location: INTERSECTION OF BLACKROCK RD AND HWY 70
desc_remedial_action: LOCAL SHERIFF, FIRE DEPT AND MILITARY PERSONNEL WERE ON SCENE, AREA WAS CORDONED OFF, CLEAN UP IS UNDERWAY

description_of_incident: ON 05-SEP-2017 (TIME UNKNOWN) LIGHTNING STUCK A SIGNAL BOX ("BUNGALOW") ON THE MAINLINE. RP STATED THAT THE TRACK EQUIPMENT CAUGHT ON FIRE DUE TO THE INCIDENT, IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE BATTERY ACID WAS BURNED OFF IN THE FIRE.  NO REPORTED INJURIES OR EVACUATIONS.  RP STATED THIS DID NOT EFFECT ANY TRAIN TRAFFIC.
desc_remedial_action: THE EQUIPMENT WAS REPLACED/REPAIRED. ANY REQUIRED MITIGATION WAS COMPLETED.
additional_info: **RP WILL NOTIFY AZ DEQ NEXT.

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING A TWO VEHICLE COLLISION IN WHICH A COMMERCIAL TRUCK'S SADDLE TANK WAS PUNCTURED AND DISCHARGED DIESEL FUEL ONTO THE ROADWAY AND A STORM DRAIN. THE CALLER DOES NOT KNOW IF THERE WERE INJURIES.
desc_remedial_action: THE CALLER STATES THAT ABSORBANT MATERIAL HAS BEEN PLACED ON THE ROADWAY.  THE CALLER PLACED MICROBLAZE INTO THE STORM DRAIN.

description_of_incident: A CALLER REPORTED A RELEASE OF APPX. 1-3 GALLONS OF LINE-X XS-100 ISOCYANATE ONTO AN ASPHALT ROADWAY FROM A METAL DRUM SOMETIME IN OCTOBER 2016 BUT IT WAS NEVER REPORTED AT THE TIME OF THE RELEASE. THE CALLER STATED THAT WHILE THE DRUM WAS BEING LOADED ONTO A DISPOSAL TRUCK, THE SAID MATERIAL WAS RELEASED FROM THE 55 GALLON METAL DRUM SOMEHOW. THE CALLER STATED THAT HE/SHE RECENTLY BECAME AWARE OF THE RELEASE DURING AN INVESTIGATION FOR A DIFFERENT MATTER AND DECIDED TO MAKE THE REPORT.
desc_remedial_action: WILL HIRE A CONTRACTOR TO REMOVE THE IMPACTED ASPHALT IN NEAR FUTURE
additional_info: **ADDITION INFORMATION ON THE RELEASED MATERIAL: CHEMICAL COMPOUND MAKE UP CAS NO.101-68-8 50%<, CAS NO. 25686-28-6 20%<, CAS NO. 26447-40-5 3%<

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A STORM CAUSED A HOUSE BOAT TO TIP OVER ONTO THE BEACH AND ROCKS CAUSING A DISCHARGE OF FUEL INTO THE WATER. THE CALLER STATES THAT THERE WERE 19 PEOPLE ON BOARD AT THE TIME AND 3 PEOPLE SUFFERED LACERATIONS.  ONE OF THOSE INJURED WAS TAKEN TO THE HOSPITAL.
desc_remedial_action: THE CALLER STATES THAT THE VESSEL IS BOOMED.

description_of_incident: THE RP IS REPORTING A FREIGHT TRAIN VERSUS TRESPASSER INCIDENT RESULTING IN A FATALITY.  RP STATED THE TRESPASSER WAS ON FOOT AND WAS REPORTEDLY FOULING THE MAIN LINE PRIOR TO BEING STRUCK.  **CONFIRMATION TIME OF FATALITY WAS PROVIDED AT 2003 MT (DISCOVERED).
desc_remedial_action: LOCAL RESPONDERS WERE ON SCENE.
additional_info: **THE TRACK WAS RE-OPENED AT 2011 MT. **RP STATED THE CROSSING WAS CLOSED FOR AN HOUR AND A HALF AS WELL.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED A FREIGHT TRAIN STRUCK A TRESPASSER AT A GRADE CROSSING WHICH RESULTED IN FATAL INJURIES. TRACK CLOSURE IS STILL ONGOING AT THIS TIME.
desc_remedial_action: LOCAL PD ONSCENE, INVESTIGATION IS UNDERWAY.
additional_info: AZ CORP COMMISSION REPORT # VGRR201709180050

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A PRESSURE RELIEF VALVE ACTIVATED, RESULTING IN A RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.
desc_remedial_action: FIRE DEPARTMENT ON SCENE

description_of_incident: COOLANT RELEASED FROM A TRACTOR TRAILER, DUE TO A HOLE IN THE FLUID LINE. AN ESTIMATED 5 GALLONS IMPACTED A NEARBY STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: * CONTRACTOR ON-SITE.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER HIT A GUARD RAIL ON THE DRIVER SIDE, DAMAGING A SADDLE TANK. THIS CAUSED THE DISCHARGE OF 50 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL ONTO SOIL AND ASPHALT.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR ENROUTE

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT THEY WERE USING A WATER HOSE WHICH RUPTURED AND RELEASED 10 GALLONS OF TAP WATER INTO THE STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: REPLACED HOSE

description_of_incident: THE CALLER STATES THAT A TRESPASSER CAME OUT OF THE BUSHES, LAID DOWN ON THE TRACKS AND WAS STRUCK BY AN ONCOMING TRAIN RESULTING IN ONE FATALITY.
incident_location: NORTH 7TH AVE AND EAST 7TH ST (NEAREST INTERSTECTION).
desc_remedial_action: INVESTIGATION UNDERWAY

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING A RELEASE OF AN UNKNOWN CHEMICAL LIQUID THAT IS ALL OVER THE ROADWAY FROM AN UNKNOWN SOURCE.  CALLER STATES THE MATERIAL IS ORANGE AND REDDISH IN COLOR AND IT GIVES OFF A SULFURIC ODOR WHEN ATTEMPTING TO CLEAN IT UP.  CALLER ALSO STATES THE MATERIAL STRETCHES FOR A .5 MILE ALONG THE ROAD.

A CALLER REPORTED A DISCHARGE OF 100 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL ONTO ROADWAY/ASPHALT FROM A RUPTURED LEFT SADDLE TANK OF A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK THAT WAS INVOLVED IN AN AUTOMOTIVE VEHICULAR ACCIDENT ON US-730 AT OR NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF WILLAMETTE AVENUE.
desc_remedial_action: A LOCAL FD REMEDIATED THE ACCIDENT AREA, A CONTRACTOR EN ROUTE FOR FURTHER CLEAN-UP

description_of_incident: APPROXIMATELY 50 GALLONS OF DIESEL DISCHARGED FROM SADDLE TANK OF A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK, AFTER A ROCK STRUCK THE TANK AND CAUSED A PUNCTURE.
desc_remedial_action: PRODUCT CONTAINED, REMEDIATION UNDERWAY.

description_of_incident: NON-PCB MINERAL OIL DISCHARGED FROM A PAD MOUNTED TRANSFORMER THAT WAS STRUCK BY A CAR.
desc_remedial_action: REPLACED THE TRANSFORMER AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE WAS CALLED.  ABSORBENTS WERE ALSO APPLIED.
additional_info: DEPT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (DEQ) WILL BE NOTIFIED.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS MAKING A REPORT INVOLVING A TRESPASSER FATALITY THAT WAS DISCOVERED ON RAILROAD PROPERTY.  CALLER STATES THE BODY WAS FOUND WITH A HEAD WOUND AND IT IS UNKNOWN IF A TRAIN WAS INVOLVED AT THIS TIME.
incident_location: AT THE CORNER OF WEST SPEEDWAY BLVD & ANITA ST.
desc_remedial_action: LOCAL AUTHORITIES ARE ONSCENE TO CONDUCT INVESTIGATION.
additional_info: THE TRACK CLOSURE IS STILL ONGOING.  AZ CORPORATE COMMISSION REPORT NUMBER: VG-RR201710090949.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRAIN STRUCK A TRESPASSER RESULTING IN A FATALITY.
desc_remedial_action: MADE NOTIFICATIONS.  LOCAL AUTHORITIES RESPONDED.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRAIN STRUCK AND INJURED A TRESPASSER.
desc_remedial_action: MADE NOTIFICATION.  LOCAL AUTHORITIES RESPONDED.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS MAKING A REPORT INVOLVING A SMOKING BATTERY PACK ON A FLIGHT.  CALLER STATES THE BATTERY PACK MELTED SO THEY HAD TO RETURN BACK TO THE GATE.  BATTERY PACK WAS IN A PASSENGER BAG IN AN OVERHEAD BIN.
incident_location: FLIGHT 766; FROM PHOENIX TO LOUISVILLE; GATE C18
desc_remedial_action: PLANE RETURNED TO THE GATE, THE BATTERY PACK WAS PLACED IN A YELLOW CONTAINMENT BAG AND THE BAG WAS TURNED OVER TO THE MANAGER.  MAINTENANCE WAS ALSO CALLED OUT TO MAKE A LOG BOOK ENTRY.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED A CUSTOMER LEFT THE GAS PUMP UNATTENDED AT A GAS STATION.   THERE WAS A SPILL OF 30-40 GALLONS OF GASOLINE AS THE GAS PUMP DID NOT SHUT OFF.
desc_remedial_action: CALLER STATED THEY BLOCKED OFF THE AREA.   THEY DROPPED DOWN KITTEN LITTER AND PADS.

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER FUEL LINE WAS PUNCTURED DUE TO ROAD DEBRIS CAUSING THE DISCHARGE OF DIESEL ONTO THE ROADWAY AND INTO A STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: THE CALLER STATES THAT THE DRIVER PUT HIS MATTRESS UNDER THE VEHICLE TO CATCH THE RELEASE AND AN ENVIRONMENTAL CONTRACTOR IS ROUTE.

description_of_incident: CALLER REPORTED A TRACTOR TRAILER HAD A FRONT RIGHT TIRE BLOWOUT THAT CAUSED THE TRUCK TO HIT A METAL GUARD RAIL, RUPTURE ITS FUEL TANK AND CAUSED A SPARK THAT IGNITED THE FUEL.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR IS IN ROUTE.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER SLID INTO THE MEDIAN DUE TO ICY ROAD CONDITIONS. THE TRUCK DISCHARGED MOTOR OIL ONTO THE GROUND.
desc_remedial_action: PD ON SCENE, SOIL REMEDIATION

description_of_incident: THE CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A REFRIGERATION UNIT RELEASED FREON DURING MAINTENANCE SERVICES.  THE CALLER STATES THAT EMPLOYEES AND VENDORS WERE EVACUATED AND THERE WERE NO INJURIES.
desc_remedial_action: THE CALLER STATES THAT UNIT UNIT WAS SHUT DOWN AND CONTAINED.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT DUE TO A MULTIPLE VEHICLE ACCIDENT, 50-60 GALLONS OF DIESEL HAS BEEN DISCHARGED ONTO THE GROUND AND ABOUT 30 OF THAT WENT INTO A NEARBY STORM DRAIN. THE PRODUCT WAS DISCHARGED FROM THE SADDLE TANK OF A DUMP TRUCK. THERE WERE INJURIES AS A RESULT OF THE ACCIDENT, HOWEVER THE NUMBER INJURED AND THEIR OUTCOME IS UNKNOWN. THE ROADWAY IS NOW OPEN.
desc_remedial_action: PD/FD ON-SCENE, CONTRACTOR ENROUTE
additional_info: CALLER IS MAKING FURTHER NOTIFICATIONS

description_of_incident: POTABLE WATER RELEASED FROM A 6 INCH WATER LINE DUE TO ACCIDENTAL BREAKAGE DURING EXCAVATION.
incident_location: SKY HARBOR AIRPORT; NEXT TO THE EXECUTIVE TERMINAL
desc_remedial_action: PROTECTED THE CATCH BASIN AND CLEANED UP THE SEDIMENT AS SOON AS THEY WERE ABLE TO CONTROL THE FLOW.

description_of_incident: CALLER REPORTS A VESSEL IS SINKING AND HAS DISCHARGED ABOUT A TEASPOON OF AN UNKNOWN OIL CAUSING A SHEEN.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THAT 60 GALLONS OF DIESEL WAS DISCHARGED FROM THE SADDLE TANK OF A TRACTOR TRAILER ONTO PAVEMENT, DUE TO AN UNKNOWN CAUSE.  APPROXIMATELY 15 GALLONS REACHED A NEARBY STORM DRAIN.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES OR FATALITIES REPORTED.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED DUE TO OPERATOR ERROR A TRACTOR TRAILER LOSS CONTROL AND JACK-KNIFIED ON INTERSTATE 275 NORTHBOUND AT EXIT 17.   THIS RESULTED IN THE RUPTURE OF THE SADDLE TANK OF THE VEHICLE AND A SPILL OF 50 GALLONS OF DIESEL.   CALLER STATED 5-10 GALLONS OF THE DIESEL SPILL REACHED A STORM DRAIN.
desc_remedial_action: CONTRACTOR HAS BEEN HIRED AND IS SECURING THE AREA.   THE CONTRACTOR WILL RETURN AT A LATER DATE TO REMOVE THE IMPACTED SOIL.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER STRUCK A VEHICLE ON THE SIDE. THIS RESULTED IN THE DISCHARGE OF RADIATOR FLUID ONTO THE GROUND AND INTO A NEARBY DITCH. THE DRIVER OF THE PASSENGER TRUCK SUFFERED FATAL INJURIES.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED THERE WAS A SPILL OF ONE GALLON OF HYDRAULIC OIL FROM A TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK DUE TO A MECHANICAL FAILURE WITH THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM OF THE VEHICLE.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT THE COMPANY DUMPS LARGE VATS OF CHEMICAL DEGREASER ON THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING WHEN NEW DEGREASER IS PURCHASED. CALLER STATES THAT THIS HAS BEEN OCCURRING USUALLY EVERY THREE MONTHS FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF TIME.
THE CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A PROGRAMMING ISSUE CAUSED A LIFT STATION TO BACK UP AND RELEASE ABOUT 500 GALLONS OF RAW SEWAGE INTO A WASH AREA BUT THE WASH WAS DRY AT THE TIME.
desc_remedial_action: THE CALLER STATES THAT THEY CLEANED THE SPILL WITH BEACH WATER.

description_of_incident: CALLER STATED 100 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL RELEASED ONTO THE SOIL FROM THE SADDLE TANK OF A TRACTOR TRAILER. THIS WAS DUE TO DRIVER RUNNING OFF THE ROAD AND HITTING A GUARD RAIL THEN RUNNING INTO SOME TREES.

description_of_incident: CALLER IS REPORTING THAT A TRACTOR TRAILER STRUCK THE CENTER DIVIDER, THIS RESULTED IN THE DISCHARGE OF DIESEL FROM THE SADDLE TANK AND MOTOR OIL FROM THE ENGINE ONTO THE ROADWAY WITH NO WATERWAY IMPACT. NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED.
